subclassFeature.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
entries: {@i Invoke Past Warriors to Guard Your Allies}

Barbarians who follow the Path of the Ancestral Guardian come from cultures deeply connected to their ancestors, who are believed to offer guidance and protection. When these barbarians enter a rage, they summon ancestral guardians to aid them in battle. They use their ancestors’ power to defend their allies and tribe, and their intricate tattoos honor their heritage by depicting heroic victories and preserving the legacy of their forebears.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Spectral warriors appear when you enter your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1}. While you're raging, the first creature you hit with an attack on your turn becomes the target of the warriors, which hinder its attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on any attack roll that doesn’t target you. In addition, if the target hits a creature other than you with an attack, the recipient has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage dealt by the attack. The effect on the target ends early if your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Shield
entries: The guardian spirits that aid you provide supernatural protection to your allies. While you are raging, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the amount of damage another creature you can see within 30 feet takes by a number of {@dice d6}s equal to your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} damage bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: You gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits. When you do so, you can cast the {@spell Augury|XPHB} or {@spell Clairvoyance|XPHB} spell, without expending a spell slot or Material components. Rather than creating a spherical sensor, this use of Clairvoyance invisibly summons one of your ancestral spirits to the chosen location. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
After you cast either spell in this way, you can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: Your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to retaliate. When you use your {@subclassFeature Spirit Shield|Barbarian|XPHB|Ancestral Guardian|RTReestablished|6} to reduce the damage of an attack, the attacker takes Force damage equal to the amount of damage your Spirit Shield prevented.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Battlerager
entries: {@i Become a Living Weapon in the Heat of Battle}

Barbarians who follow the Path of the Battlerager are fierce devotees of the gods of war, known among their kin as Kuldjargh or "axe idiots". These warriors don spiked armor and engage in battle with reckless abandon, using their very bodies as weapons. Embracing the raw fury of combat, Battleragers throw themselves into the fray, their every movement a brutal, calculated assault. Their armor becomes a deadly extension of their rage, turning them into unstoppable forces of destruction on the battlefield.

subclassFeature.name: Fearless Armorer
entries: As a follower of the Path of the Battlerager you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Tools for War
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Leatherworker's Tools|XPHB}.

items.name: Spiked Armor
items.entry: On a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can use your {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Leatherworker's Tools|XPHB} to add spikes to any light or medium armor, crafting a {@item Spiked Armor|SCAG}.

entries: Additionally, you gain the following benefits while wearing Spiked Armor:

items.name: Blunt Defense
items.entry: You can use your Constitution modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier in the {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} calculation.

items.name: Grapple
items.entry: You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} (Grapple option only).

items.name: Spike Strike
items.entry: You can use your Spiked Armor as a {@filter melee weapon|items|type=melee weapon} you are proficient with, and it deals {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage. This damage increases to {@damage 1d8} at 9th level and {@damage 1d10} at 16th level.

items.name: Constrict
items.entry: At the start of each of your turns, you can deal Piercing damage equal to your {@i Spike Strike} damage die to one creature {@condition Grappled} by you.

items.name: Weapon Mastery
items.entry: You can customize your Spiked Armor in the crafting process, when you do so, choose one of the following {@variantrule Weapon Mastery Properties|XPHB|Weapon masteries}: {@itemMastery Vex|XPHB}, {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB}, {@itemMastery Push|XPHB} or {@itemMastery Sap|XPHB}. You can use the chosen property when you hit with your {@i Spike Strike}. This weapon mastery can be changed using your {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Leatherworker's Tools|XPHB} when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries: Any creature that uses the Spiked Armor without being proficient with it will take one instance of the Spiked Armor damage die for every 5 feet of movement.

subclassFeature.name: Spiked Mastery
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. Additionally, while wearing {@item Spiked Armor|SCAG}, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Necrotic Spikes
items.entry: Whenever you deal Piercing damage with your Spiked Armor's attacks or any other feature of this subclass, you can choose to deal Necrotic damage instead.

items.name: Spiked Retribution
items.entry: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, it takes Piercing damage equal to your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} Damage Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Traction Spikes
entries: You gain the following benefits while wearing {@item Spiked Armor|SCAG}:

items.name: Climbing
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed.

items.name: Dash
items.entry: You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action using your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while raging. Additionally, when you take this Bonus Action, {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you.

subclassFeature.name: Spiked Grappler
entries: Your mastery in the use of the {@item Spiked Armor|SCAG} and grappling allow you to get the following benefits when using your Spiked Armor:

items.name: Spiked Bind
items.entry: The first creature you hit on your turn with your Spiked Armor has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next Saving Throw it makes to resist being {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you before the end of your next turn.

items.name: Spiked Grip
items.entry: A creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks to escape the Grapple.

items.name: Spiked Wounds
items.entry: When a {@condition Grappled|XPHB} creature fails an ability check to escape, it takes Piercing damage equal to your {@i Spike Strike} damage die.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Beast
entries: {@i Let Your Rage Morph You into a Ferocious Being}

Barbarians who follow the Path of the Beast tap into a primal fury that transforms them into powerful, beastly forms. This bestial essence surges forth during their rage, altering their physical appearance and abilities. Whether inherited from a lycanthropic parent, bestowed by an archdruid, granted by a fey spirit, or awakened by an ancient animal spirit, this primal power embodies their deepest connection to the wild.

subclassFeature.name: Form of the Beast
entries: When you enter your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1}, you can transform, revealing the bestial power within you. Until the Rage ends, you manifest a natural weapon. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with it, as normal. You choose the weapon's form each time you Rage.

items.name: Bite
items.entry: Your mouth transforms into a bestial muzzle or great mandibles (your choice). It deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you damage an enemy with this bite, you regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Constitution modifier.

items.name: Claws
items.entry: Each of your hands transforms into a claw, which you can use as a weapon if it's empty. It deals {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you attack with a claw using the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can make one additional claw attack as part of the same action.

items.name: Tail
items.entry: You grow a lashing, spiny tail, which deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage on a hit and has the Reach property. If a creature you can see within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to swipe your tail and roll a {@dice d8}, applying a bonus to your AC equal to the number rolled until the start of your next turn, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Soul
entries: The feral power within you increases. Whenever you deal damage with any of your {@subclassFeature Form of the Beast|Barbarian|XPHB|Beast|RTReestablished|3}'s natural weapons, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

Additionally, you can also alter your form to help you adapt to your surroundings. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you finish your next Short or Long Rest:

items.name: Swim
items.entry: You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed, and you can breathe underwater.

items.name: Climb
items.entry: You gain a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

items.name: Jump
items.entry: When you jump, you can make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check and extend your jump by a number of feet equal to the check's total. You can make this special check only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Fury
entries: When you hit a creature with the natural weapons of your {@subclassFeature Form of the Beast|Barbarian|XPHB|Beast|RTReestablished|3}, you can curse your target with rabid fury. It makes a Wisdom  saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}). On a failed save it has one of the following curses:

items.name: Rabid Frenzy
items.entry: The target must use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack against another creature of your choice that you can see.

items.name: Rabid Decay
items.entry: The target takes {@damage 2d12} Psychic damage.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifer, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Call the Hunt
entries: The beast within you grows so powerful that you can spread its ferocity to others and gain resilience from them joining your hunt. When you enter your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1}, you can choose a number of willing creatures you can see within 30 feet of you equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 1). You gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} for each creature that accepts this feature. While your Rage is active, once on their turns, the chosen creatures can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage on an attack they make.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Giant
entries: {@i Channel the Colossal Might of Giants}

Barbarians who follow the Path of the Giant draw upon the elemental forces that giants harness, growing in both size and strength as they rage. Their fury manifests in awe-inspiring transformations, where they may appear as towering versions of themselves with elemental energy crackling around them, or they might assume the majestic form of a giant or elemental being, surrounded by fire, frost, or lightning. These transformations reflect the immense power and grandeur of giants, making them formidable and awe-inspiring figures on the battlefield.

subclassFeature.name: Giant's Power
entries: The primal force of giants wreaths within you.

items.name: Giant's Tongue
items.entry: You can speak, read, and write {@language Giant|XPHB} or one other language of your choice if you already know Giant.

items.name: Giant Magic
items.entry: You learn one cantrip of your choice: {@spell Elementalism|XPHB}, {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB} or {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for that spell.

subclassFeature.name: Giant's Havoc
entries: Your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} pulls strength from the primal might of giants, transforming you into a hulking force of destruction. While raging, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Giant's Cleaver
items.entry: You choose one weapon you are holding and infuse it with primordial power. It gains the Thrown (20/60) property and if it already has the Thrown property its normal and long range increase by 20 feet. If you throw the weapon, it instantly reappears in your hand after you hit or miss a target. The weapon's infusion is suppressed while a creature other than you wields it.

items.name: Giant Stature
items.entry: Your reach increases by 5 feet, and if you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If there isn't enough room for you to increase your size, your size doesn't change.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Might
entries: Your physique is bolstered by the primordial elements.

items.name: Elemental Resistance
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to one of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Thunder, or Lightning. You can choose a different type when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Elemental Cleaver
items.entry: When you use your Giant's Cleaver, the weapon is infused with one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Thunder, or Lightning. Its damage type changes to the chosen type and it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage on a hit. You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to change the damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Impel
entries: Your connection to giant strength allows you to hurl both allies and enemies on the battlefield. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, you can choose one Medium or smaller creature within your reach and move it to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Strength modifier and your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) to avoid the effect.
If, at the end of this movement, the thrown creature isn't on a surface or liquid that can support it, the creature falls, taking damage and gaining the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Demiurgic Colossus
entries: The primordial power of your rage intensifies.

items.name: Colossal Stature
items.entry: While your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, your reach increases by 10 feet, your size can increase to Large or Huge (your choice), and you can use your {@subclassFeature Mighty Impel|Barbarian|XPHB|Giant|RTReestablished|10} to move creatures that are Large or smaller.

items.name: Improved Elemental Cleaver
items.entry: The extra damage dealt by your {@i Elemental Cleaver} feature increases to {@damage 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Storm Herald
entries: {@i Let your Fury Roar with the Force of the Elements}

Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald channel their inner fury into a vibrant mantle of elemental magic. When they enter a rage, this primal magic swirls around them, harnessing the raw forces of nature to create powerful effects. Whether they train alongside druids and rangers, or hone their skills in storm-battered lodges, icy frontiers, or scorching deserts; Storm Heralds become elite champions imbued with nature’s fierce energies.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Aura
entries: While your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, a storm whips around you in a 10 foot {@variantrule Emanation|XPHB}. Choose {@i Desert}, {@i Sea}, or {@i Tundra}. Your aura's effect depends on that chosen environment, as detailed below. You can change your environment choice whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Strength modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.
As part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you use to activate or maintain your Rage, you can cause one of the following effects.

items.name: Desert
items.entry: All other creatures of your choice within the Emanation take Fire damage equal to 1 plus your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} Damage bonus.

items.name: Sea
items.entry: You choose one other creature you can see within the Emanation. It must make a Dexterity saving throw. Roll a number of (@dice d6)s equal to your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} Damage bonus minus 1 and add them together. On a failure it takes Lightning damage equal to the total rolled, or half as much damage on a success.

items.name: Tundra
items.entry: Each creature of your choice within the Emanation gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 1 plus your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} Damage bonus, as icy spirits inure it to suffering.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Soul
entries: The storm grants you benefits even when your {@subclassFeature Storm Aura|Barbarian|XPHB|Storm Herald|RTReestablished|3} isn't active. The benefits are based on the environment you chose for your Storm Aura.

items.name: Desert
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage and gain {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 10 feet.

items.name: Sea
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Lightning damage, and you can breathe underwater. You also gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} of 30 feet.

items.name: Tundra
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage and the area inside your Storm Aura is considered {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for your enemies.

entries: In addition, you learn the {@spell Elementalism|XPHB} cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Shielding Storm
entries: You learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect others. Each creature of your choice has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage type of your {@subclassFeature Storm Soul|Barbarian|XPHB|Storm Herald|RTReestablished|6} feature while it is within your {@subclassFeature Storm Aura|Barbarian|XPHB|Storm Herald|RTReestablished|3}.

subclassFeature.name: Raging Storm
entries: The power of the storm you channel grows mightier, lashing out at your foes. The effect is based on the environment you chose for your {@subclassFeature Storm Aura|Barbarian|XPHB|Storm Herald|RTReestablished|3}.

items.name: Desert
items.entry: Immediately after a creature in your aura hits you with an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes Fire damage equal to half your Barbarian level.

items.name: Sea
items.entry: Once per turn when you hit a creature in your aura with an attack, you can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, as if struck by a wave.

items.name: Tundra
items.entry: Whenever the effect of your Storm Aura is activated, you can choose one creature you can see in the aura. That creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn, as magical frost covers it.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Wild Magic
entries: {@i Embrace the Chaotic Magic of the Wild}

Barbarians who tread the Path of Wild Magic are deeply attuned to realms of raw emotion and potent magic, such as the Feywild or the Upper Planes. Their intense feelings make them receptive to these mystical forces, transforming them into conduits of wild magic. Barbarians from elven, tiefling, aasimar, or genasi lineages often follow this path, seeking to channel the arcane power of their heritage into unpredictable and potent effects in battle.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Rage
entries: The magical energy roiling inside you unleash when you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1}. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Magic Awareness
items.entry: While raging, you are under the effects of the {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} spell. The range you sense the presence of magic is 60 feet and you don't need to {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrate} on it.

items.name: Wild Surge
items.entry: When you enter your Rage, roll on the {@table Wild Magic|RTReestablished} table to determine the magical effect produced. If the effect requires a Saving Throw, the DC equals 8 plus your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} and your Strength modifier.

entries.caption: Wild Magic
rows: Shadowy tendrils lash around you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} Necrotic damage. You also gain 1d12 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

You teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

An intangible spirit, which looks like a {@creature Flumph|XMM} or a {@creature Pixie|XMM} (your choice), appears within 5 feet of one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At the end of the current turn, the spirit explodes, and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Force damage. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you can use this effect again, summoning another spirit, on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

Magic infuses one weapon of your choice that you are holding. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, the weapon's damage type changes to Force, and it gains the Light and Thrown properties, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If the weapon leaves your hand, the weapon reappears in your hand at the end of the current turn.
Whenever a creature hits you with an attack roll before your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} Force damage, as magic lashes out in retribution.

Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you are surrounded by multi colored, protective lights; you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and while within 10 feet of you, your allies gain the same bonus.
Flowers and vines temporarily grow around you. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, the ground within 15 feet of you is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for your enemies.

A bolt of light shoots from your chest. Another creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage and have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Magic
entries: You can harness your wild magic to bolster yourself or a companion. As an {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch one creature (which can be yourself) and confer one of the following benefits of your choice to that creature:

items.name: Magic Guidance
items.entry: Whenever the creature makes an attack roll or ability check, it can roll a {@dice d4} and add it to the result. This effect lasts for 10 minutes.

items.name: Mana Recovery
items.entry: Roll a {@dice d6}. The creature regains one expended spell slot, the level of which equals half the number rolled (rounded up) or lower (the creature's choice).After recieving this benefit, a creature must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before it can do so again..

entries: You can take this action a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Backlash
entries: When you are imperiled during your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1}, the magic within you can lash out. When you take damage or fail a saving throw while your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} is active, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll on the {@table Wild Magic|RTReestablished} table and immediately produce the effect. This effect replaces the active Wild Magic effect.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Surge
entries: Whenever you roll on the {@table Wild Magic|RTReestablished} table, you can roll the die twice and choose which of the two effects to unleash. If you roll the same number on both dice, you can ignore the number and choose any effect on the table.

subclassFeature.name: College of Creation
entries: {@i Shape the World with the Song of Creation}

Bards of the College of Creation view the cosmos as a divine masterpiece, crafted by the first dragons and gods. They tap into the Song of Creation, a primordial melody that echoes through all things. Through dance, music, and poetry, these bards learn to awaken the world around them, giving voice to stones and breath to mountains, inviting all of existence to join in the cosmic dance.

subclassFeature.name: Mote of Potential
entries: Whenever you give a creature a {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} die, you can utter a note from the Song of Creation to create a Tiny mote of potential, which orbits within 5 feet of that creature. The mote is intangible and invulnerable, and it lasts until the Bardic Inspiration die is lost. The mote looks like a musical note, a star, a flower, or another symbol of art or life that you choose.
When the creature uses the Bardic Inspiration die, the mote provides an additional effect based on whether the die benefits an ability check, an attack roll, or a saving throw, as detailed below:

items.name: Ability Check
items.entry: When the creature rolls the Bardic Inspiration die to add it to an ability check, the creature can roll the Bardic Inspiration die again and choose which roll to use, as the mote pops and emits colorful, harmless sparks for a moment.

items.name: Attack Roll
items.entry: If the attack roll still misses, the Bardic Inspiration die is not expended, as the mote makes a rising motif.

items.name: Saving Throw
items.entry: Immediately after the creature rolls the Bardic Inspiration die and adds it to a saving throw, the mote vanishes with the sound of soft music, causing the creature to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled on the Bardic Inspiration die plus your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 Temporary Hit Point).

subclassFeature.name: Performance of Creation
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can channel the magic of the Song of Creation to create one {@filter nonmagical item|items|miscellaneous=mundane} of your choice in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you. The item must appear on a surface or in a liquid that can support it. The gp value of the item can't be more than 20 times your bard level, and the item must be Medium or smaller. The item glimmers softly, and a creature can faintly hear music when touching it. The created item disappears after a number of hours equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1 hour). For examples of items you can create, see the {@book Equipment|XPHB|6} chapter of the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB}.

Once you create an item with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a spell slot of level 2+ to use this feature again. You can have only one item created by this feature at a time; if you take this action and already have an item from this feature, the first one immediately vanishes.
The size of the item you can create with this feature increases by one size category when you reach level 6 (Large) and level 14 (Huge).

subclassFeature.name: Animating Performance
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can animate one Large or smaller {@filter nonmagical item|items|miscellaneous=mundane} within 30 feet of you that isn't being worn or carried. The animated item uses the {@creature Dancing Item|RTReestablished} stat block, which uses your Charisma modifier. The item is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your companions and obeys your commands. It lives for 1 hour, until it is reduced to 0 Hit Points, or until you die.

In combat, the item shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the item can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.
When you use your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} feature, you can command the item as part of the same Bonus Action you use for Bardic Inspiration.

Once you animate an item with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a spell slot of level 3+ to restore your use of it (no action required). You can have only one item animated by this feature at a time; if you use this action and already have a dancing item from this feature, the first one immediately becomes inanimate.

subclassFeature.name: Creative Crescendo
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Performance of Creation|Bard|XPHB|Creation|RTReestablished|3} feature, you can create more than one item at once. The number of items equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of two items). If you create an item that would exceed that number, you choose which of the previously created items disappears. Only one of these items can be of the maximum size you can create; the rest must be Small or Tiny.
You are no longer limited by gp value when creating items with Performance of Creation.

subclassFeature.name: College of Eloquence
entries: {@i Influence the Hearts of Many with Unforgettable Words}

Bards of the College of Eloquence are masters of oratory, where persuasion is seen as a form of art. These bards blend logic with theatrical flair, using well-crafted arguments and emotional appeals to sway hearts and minds, proving that a skillful tongue can be mightier than any fact.

subclassFeature.name: Silver Tongue
entries: You are a master at saying the right thing at the right time. When you make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB} or {@skill Deception}) check, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Unsettling Words
entries: You can spin words laced with magic that unsettle a creature and cause it to doubt itself. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} and choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Roll the Bardic Inspiration die. The creature must subtract the number rolled from the next saving throw it makes before the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unfailing Inspiration
entries: Your inspiring words are so persuasive that others feel driven to succeed. When a creature adds one of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} dice to a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and the roll fails, the creature can keep the Bardic Inspiration die.

subclassFeature.name: Universal Speech
entries: You have gained the ability to make your speech intelligible to any creature. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose one or more creatures within 60 feet of you, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). The chosen creatures can magically understand you, regardless of the language you speak, for 1 hour.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a spell slot to restore its use (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Inspiration
entries: When you successfully inspire someone, the power of your eloquence can now spread to someone else. When a creature within 60 feet of you adds one of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} dice to a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and the roll succeeds, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to encourage a different creature (other than yourself) that can hear you within 60 feet of you, giving it a Bardic Inspiration die without expending any of your Bardic Inspiration uses.
You can use this Reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Spirits
entries: {@i Speak with the Voices Beyond}

Bards of the College of Spirits draw upon tales with deep power—legends, histories, and fictions alike—then bring them to life. Using mystical rituals, these bards summon spiritual manifestations of powerful forces to alter reality. However, these spirits are unpredictable, and what the bard conjures is not always within their control.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Medium
entries: Your bond with the spirit world lets you use items to commune with spectral guides.

items.name: Spiritual Focus
items.entry: You can use the following objects as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your {@filter Bard spells|spells|class=bard}: a {@item candle|XPHB}, {@item crystal ball|XDMG}, skull, {@item spirit board|XDMG}, or {@deck tarokka deck|CoS}.

items.name: Guiding Whispers
items.entry: You can reach out to spirits to guide you and others. You learn the {@spell Guidance|XPHB} cantrip, which doesn't count against the number of {@filter Bard cantrips|spells|class=bard|level=0} you know. When you cast it while holding your Spiritual Focus, it has a range of 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Tales from Beyond
entries: You reach out to spirits who tell their tales through you. While you are holding your Spiritual Focus, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} and roll on the {@table Spirit Tales|RTReestablished} table using your Bardic Inspiration die to determine the tale the spirits direct you to tell. You retain the tale in mind until you bestow the tale's effect or you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you (this can be you) to be the target of the tale's effect. Once you do so, you can't bestow the tale's effect again until you roll it again.
You can retain only one of these tales in mind at a time, and rolling on the Spirit Tales table immediately ends the effect of the previous tale.
If the tale requires a saving throw, the DC equals your spell save DC.

entries.caption: Spirit Tales
rows: {@i {@b Tale of the Clever Animal.}} For the next 10 minutes, whenever the target makes an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma check, the target can roll an extra die and add the extra die's number to the check. The extra die is the same type as your Bardic Inspiration die.

{@i {@b Tale of the Renowned Duelist.}} You make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to two rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier.

{@i {@b Tale of the Beloved Friends.}} The target and another creature of its choice it can see within 5 feet of it gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier.

{@i {@b Tale of the Runaway.}} The target can immediately take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. When the target teleports, it can choose a number of creatures it can see within 30 feet of it up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0) to immediately use the same Reaction.
{@i {@b Tale of the Avenger.}} For 1 minute, any creature that hits the target with a melee attack takes Force damage equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die.

{@i {@b Tale of the Traveler.}} The target gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Bard level. While it has these Temporary Hit Points, the target's Speed increases by 10 feet and it gains a +1 bonus to its AC.

{@i {@b Tale of the Beguiler.}} The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take Psychic damage equal to two rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die, and the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

{@i {@b Tale of the Phantom.}} The target gains the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn or until it hits a creature with an attack. If the target hits a creature with an attack before the condition ends, the creature it hits takes Necrotic damage equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition with the target as the source until the end of the creature’s next turn.

{@i {@b Tale of the Brute.}} Each creature of the target's choice it can see within 30 feet of it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Thunder damage equal to three rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage only.

{@i {@b Tale of the Dragon.}} The target spews fire from the mouth in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking Fire damage equal to four rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@i {@b Tale of the Angel.}} The target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to two rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier, and you can end one of the following conditions on it: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

{@i {@b Tale of the Mind-Bender.}} You evoke an incomprehensible fable from an otherworldly being. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take Psychic damage equal to three rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die and have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Spiritual Focus
entries: When you cast a {@filter Bard spell|spells|class=bard} that deals damage or restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} while you are holding your Spiritual Focus, roll a {@dice d6}, and you gain a bonus to one damage or healing roll of the spell equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Session
entries: Spirits provide you with supernatural insights. You can conduct an hour-long ritual channeling spirits (which can be done during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}) using your Spiritual Focus.

items.name: Ritual Participants
items.entry: You can conduct the ritual with a number of willing creatures equal to half your Bard level (rounded down, maximum 9, including yourself).

items.name: Spell Knowledge
items.entry: At the end of the ritual, you temporarily prepare {@filter one spell of your choice from any class|spells|school=D;N}. The spell you choose must be of a level equal to the number of creatures that conducted the ritual or less, the spell must be of a level you can cast, and it must be in the school of Divination or Necromancy. You always have the spell prepared until you use this feature again.

entries: Once you perform the ritual, you can't do so again until you start a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mystical Connection
entries: You now have the ability to nudge the spirits of {@subclassFeature Tales from Beyond|Bard|XPHB|Spirits|RTReestablished|3} toward certain tales. Whenever you roll on the {@table Spirit Tales|RTReestablished} table, you can roll the die twice and choose which of the two effects to bestow. If you roll the same number on both dice, you can ignore the number and choose any effect on the table.

subclassFeature.name: College of Swords
entries: {@i Master the Song of Steel}

Bards of the College of Swords, known as blades, captivate audiences with their masterful displays of weapon prowess. They dazzle with feats like sword swallowing, knife throwing, and mock combat, blending entertainment with martial skill. While their performances thrill crowds, many blades lead double lives—using their talents for either covert missions or righteous justice. Though their skills are celebrated, blades often walk a fine line between thrilling entertainers and dangerous operatives.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Training
entries: Your training in martial combat has granted you the following benefits:

items.name: Martial Training
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in {@filter Martial melee weapons|items|type=martial weapon;melee weapon|property=!reach} that lack the Reach property and Training with Medium Armor.

items.name: Spellcasting Focus
items.entry: If you have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with a {@filter Simple|items|type=simple weapon;melee weapon} or {@filter Martial melee weapon|items|type=martial weapon;melee weapon}, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your {@filter Bard spells|spells|class=bard}.

items.name: Fighting Style
items.entry: You can select one of the Fighting Style feats of your choice from the following options: {@feat Dueling|XPHB}, {@feat Interception|XPHB} or {@feat Two-Weapon Fighting|XPHB}. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can exchange your selection for another option.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Flourish
entries: You learn to perform impressive displays of martial prowess and speed. Whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, your Speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the turn, and if a weapon attack that you make as part of this action hits a creature, you can use one of the following Blade Flourish options of your choice. You can use only one Blade Flourish option per turn.

items.name: Defensive Flourish
items.entry: You can expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} to cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target you hit. The damage equals the number you roll on the Bardic Inspiration die. You also add the number rolled to your AC until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Mobile Flourish
items.entry: You can expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} to cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target you hit. The damage equals the number you roll on the Bardic Inspiration die. You can also push the target up to 5 feet away from you, plus a number of feet equal to the number you roll on that die. You can then immediately take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to your Speed to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target.

items.name: Slashing Flourish
items.entry: You can expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} to cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target you hit and to any other creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you. The damage equals the number you roll on the Bardic Inspiration die.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Mockery
entries: Your skill in the use of swords allows you to mock your opponents during the fight.

items.name: Vicious Mockery
items.entry: You know the {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} cantrip. If you already know it, you learn a different {@filter Bard cantrip|spells|class=bard|level=0} of your choice. The cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.

items.name: Quick Mockery
items.entry: After hitting a creature with a {@filter Melee weapon|items|type=melee weapon}, you can immediately use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to cast {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} targeting that creature. Once you cast Vicious Mockery in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} to regain a use of this feature (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Master's Flourish
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} to make a Melee Weapon Attack against that creature. If you hit, add the Bardic Inspiration die to the attack’s damage.

subclassFeature.name: College of Whispers
entries: {@i Unveil the Secrets of Manipulation}

Bards of the College of Whispers blend into society with charm, gathering news and sharing tales. Beneath their pleasant facade, they are trained to be wolves among sheep, using magic to uncover and exploit secrets. Often despised for their manipulative tactics, they keep their true nature hidden, infiltrating powerful circles to advance their own agendas.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Blades
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack roll or when a creature fails a saving throw against one of your {@filter Bard spells|spells|class=bard|level=1}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard|XPHB|1} to deal extra Psychic damage to that target. The damage equals two rolls of the Bardic Inspiration die. You can do so only once per round on your turn.
The Psychic damage increases to 3 rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die when you reach level 6 in this class, and to 4 rolls when you reach level 14.

subclassFeature.name: Words of Terror
entries: You have learned to infuse innocent-seeming words with an insidious magic that can inspire terror. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can attempt to seed paranoia into the mind of a creature within 5 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 hour. You can choose for the source of the fear to be yourself or another creature of your choice. If the target succeeds on its saving throw, it has no hint that you tried to frighten it.

The condition ends early if you or your allies attack it, damage it, or force it to make a saving throw. Also, if the target witnesses its allies being attacked or damaged, it can repeat its saving throw at the start of its next turn, ending the condition early on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mantle of Whispers
entries: You gain the ability to adopt a humanoid's persona. When a creature dies within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to magically capture its shadow. The creature must be a {@filter Humanoid|bestiary|type=humanoid}; or, at your DM's discretion, it must have the general appearance and size of a Humanoid (for example, a {@creature Night Hag|XMM}). You retain this shadow until you use it or you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Shadow Disguise
items.entry: You can use the shadow as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. When you do so, it vanishes, magically transforming into a disguise that appears on you. You now look like the dead person, but healthy and alive. This disguise lasts for 1 hour or until you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Disguise Knowledge
items.entry: While you're in the disguise, you gain access to all information that the creature would freely share with a casual acquaintance. Such information includes general details on its background and personal life, but doesn't include secrets. The information is enough that you can pass yourself off as the person by drawing on its memories.

items.name: Disguise Detection
items.entry: Another creature can see through this disguise by succeeding on a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check against your spell save DC.

entries: Once you capture a shadow with this feature, you can't capture another one with it until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Lore
entries: You gain the ability to weave dark magic into your words and tap into a creature's deepest fears. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can whisper a phrase that only one creature of your choice within 30 feet of you can hear. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. It automatically succeeds if it doesn't share a language with you or if it can't hear you. On a successful saving throw, your whisper sounds like unintelligible mumbling and has no effect.

On a failed saving throw, the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the next 8 hours or until you or your allies attack it, damage it, or force it to make a saving throw. It interprets the whispers as a description of its most mortifying secret. You gain no knowledge of this secret, but the target is convinced you know it.

The Charmed creature obeys your commands for fear that you will reveal its secret. It won't risk its life for you or fight for you, unless it was already inclined to do so. It grants you favors and gifts it would offer to a close friend. When the effect ends, the creature has no understanding of why it held you in such fear.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcana Domain
entries: {@i Wield the Sacred Mysteries}

The Arcana Domain taps into the fundamental magic that permeates the multiverse, driving both creation and destruction. Clerics of this domain are intimately connected to the secrets and potential of arcane power. Some view this knowledge as a sacred duty, offering a deep understanding of reality, while others see magic as raw power, to be wielded at will.

Deities of this domain are often associated with wisdom, knowledge, and the pursuit of arcane mastery. Their followers may be guardians of magical secrets, seekers of enlightenment, or those who use arcane power to shape the world responsibly.

subclassFeature.name: Arcana Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Arcana Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Arcana Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Magic Missile|XPHB}, {@spell Magic Weapon|XPHB}, {@spell Nystul's Magic Aura|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Abjuration
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you present your {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB} and expend a use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} to abjure otherworldly creatures. You cast the {@spell Banishment|XPHB} spell on an {@filter Aberration|bestiary|type=aberration}, {@filter Celestial|bestiary|type=celestial}, {@filter Elemental|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter Fey|bestiary|type=fey}, or {@filter Fiend|bestiary|type=fiend} within the spell range. You can't use this trait again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Initiate
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in the {@skill Arcana|XPHB} skill, and you learn {@filter two cantrips of your choice from the Wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}. For you, these cantrips count as Cleric cantrips. Whenever you gain a Cleric level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Wizard cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Breaker
entries: When a spell you cast with a spell slot restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, you can also end one spell of your choice on that creature on that turn. The level of the spell you end must be equal to or lower than the level of the spell slot you used to cast the healing spell.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Mastery
entries: Choose {@filter four spells from the Wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=6;7;8;9}, one from each of the following levels: 6th, 7th, 8th, and 9th. You add them to your list of domain spells. Like your other domain spells, they are always prepared and count as Cleric spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Death Domain
entries: {@i Embrace the Shadow of Mortality}

The Death Domain embodies the forces that govern life’s end and the energies animating the undead. Clerics in this domain draw on death’s power for lethal purposes or to wield necromantic forces. Dieties of this domain are linked to the underworld’s darkness or the suffering of mortality.

These gods are revered by those who see death as a tool and mortality as a weakness to exploit or shed, weather it be for good or ill intent. Religious orders may focus on rituals of passage, necromancy, or soul purification.

subclassFeature.name: Death Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Death Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Death Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Blindness/Deafness|XPHB}, {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Reaper
entries: You learn {@filter one Necromancy cantrip of your choice from any spell list|spells|school=N|level=0}. When you cast a Necromancy cantrip that normally targets only one creature, the spell can instead target two creatures within range and within 10 feet of each other.

subclassFeature.name: Wave of Death
entries: You rend another creature’s life force. Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} to deal extra Necrotic damage equal to your Wisdom modifier plus twice your Cleric level.

subclassFeature.name: Inescapable Destruction
entries: Your ability to channel negative energy becomes more potent. Necrotic damage dealt by your Cleric spells, {@classFeature Blessed Strikes|Cleric|XPHB|7} and {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} options ignores {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Reaper
entries: When you cast a {@filter Necromancy spell of levels 1-5|spells|school=N|level=1;2;3;4;5} that targets only one creature, the spell can instead target two creatures within range and within 10 feet of each other. If the spell consumes its Material components, you must provide them for both targets.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Domain
entries: {@i Temper Your Will with Holy Fire}

The Forge Domain honors the divine power of creation and craftsmanship, represented by gods who oversee metalworking. These deities inspire followers to turn raw materials into beautiful and powerful creations, teaching that with dedication, greatness can be forged from anything. Forge Domain clerics are skilled artisans, protectors of sacred forges, and seekers of rare materials for extraordinary items.

Their followers take pride in their craft, dedicating themselves to recovering lost artifacts, protecting sacred mines, or creating magical weapons and armor. These clerics are both makers and defenders, using the tools they forge to protect their communities and their creations.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Forge Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Forge Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Heat Metal|XPHB}, {@spell Identify|XPHB}, {@spell Magic Weapon|XPHB}, {@spell Searing Smite|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Artisan's Blessing
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} to create simple items. You conduct an hour-long ritual that crafts a {@filter nonmagical item|items|miscellaneous=mundane} that must include some metal: a {@filter weapon|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon}, a {@filter suit of armor|items|type=light armor;medium armor;heavy armor}, ten pieces of {@filter ammunition|items|type=ammunition}, a {@filter set of tools|items|type=artisan's tools;tool}, or another metal {@variantrule object|XPHB}. The creation is completed at the end of the hour, coalescing in an unoccupied space of your choice on a surface within 5 feet of you. The thing you create can be something that is worth no more than 100 gp. As part of this ritual, you must lay out metal, which can include coins, with a value equal to the creation. The metal irretrievably coalesces and transforms into the creation at the ritual's end, magically forming even nonmetal parts of the creation. The ritual can create a duplicate of a nonmagical item that contains metal, such as a key, if you possess the original during the ritual.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Forge
entries: You gain the ability to imbue magic into a weapon or armor.

items.name: Bonus Proficiency
items.entry: You gain a set of {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} and have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with it.

items.name: Blessed Smithing
items.entry: At the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can touch {@filter one nonmagical suit of armor, shield, or weapon|items|type=light armor;medium armor;heavy armor;shield;melee weapon;ranged weapon|miscellaneous=mundane}, magically enhancing it until the end of your next Long Rest or until you die. If you choose armor or a shield, it gains a +1 bonus to AC. If you choose a weapon, it gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and when a creature hits with it, it can choose to deal Fire damage instead of its normal damage type. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of the Forge
entries: Your mastery of the forge grants you special abilities.

items: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage.
While wearing metal armor, you have a +1 bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Saint of Forge and Fire
entries: Your blessed affinity with fire and metal becomes more powerful.

items: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Fire damage.
While wearing metal armor, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Domain
entries: {@i Honor the End of All Things}

The Grave Domain focuses on the divine management of the transition between life and death. Deities in this domain see the afterlife and the peace of the dead as crucial aspects of existence, and disturbing this peace is a severe transgression. Clerics of the Grave Domain guide wandering spirits to rest, combat undead, and ease the suffering of the dying.

Their magic can temporarily delay death for those who still have important tasks, recognizing that while death is inevitable, it can be postponed for a purpose. Followers honor the natural order, ensuring death is respected and souls are treated with reverence.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Grave Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Grave Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Mortality
entries: You gain the ability to manipulate the line between life and death.

items.name: Serenity
items.entry: When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with a spell to a creature at 0 Hit Points, you instead use the highest number possible for each die.

items.name: Safeguard
items.entry: You learn the {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} cantrip, which doesn't count against the number of Cleric cantrips you know. For you, it has a range of 30 feet greater than normal, and you can cast it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Secrets of the Grave
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} to activate one of the following effects:

items.name: Eyes of the Grave
items.entry: You open your awareness to detect {@filter Undead|bestiary|type=undead}. For the next 10 minutes or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition, you know the location of any undead within 60 feet of you that isn't behind total cover and that isn't protected from Divination magic. This sense doesn't tell you anything about a creature's capabilities or identity.

items.name: Path to the Grave
items.entry: You mark another creature's life force for termination. Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you, cursing it until the end of your next turn. The next time you or an ally hits the cursed creature with an attack, the creature has {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to all of that attack's damage, and then the curse ends.

subclassFeature.name: Sentinel at Death's Door
entries: You gain the ability to impede death's progress. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you or an ally that you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can reduce that hit's damage by half.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Keeper of Souls
entries: You can seize a trace of vitality from a parting soul and use it to heal the living. When a creature you can see dies within 30 feet of you, you or one ally of your choice that is within 30 feet of you regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the creature's number of {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} (no action required). You can use this feature only if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.
Once you use it, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Nature Domain
entries: {@i Preserve the Sanctity of Nature}

The Nature Domain honors the diverse aspects of the natural world, from ancient forest deities to nurturing spirits of springs and groves. Nature gods embody different facets of nature’s grandeur, and clerics of this domain align with these deities to protect and nurture the natural world.

While Druids revere nature as a whole and might serve one of these dieties, Nature Clerics take a much more proactive role in advancing the interests of a specific nature god. These clerics might hunt the evil monstrosities that despoil the woodlands, bless the harvest of the faithful, or wither the crops of those who anger their gods.

subclassFeature.name: Nature Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Nature Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Nature Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB}, {@spell Barkskin|XPHB}, {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB}, {@spell Spike Growth|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte of Nature
entries: You are attuned to the magic of both divine and nature.

items.name: Nature Magic
items.entry: You learn one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the Druid spell list|spells|class=druid|level=0}. This cantrip counts as a Cleric cantrip for you, but it doesn't count against the number of Cleric cantrips you know. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can exchange this cantrip for a different Druid cantrip of your choice.

items.name: Natural Talent
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, or {@skill Survival|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Influence
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you present your {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB} and expend a use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2}. You cast the {@spell Suggestion|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast Suggestion in this way, the target does not need to understand your language if it is a {@filter Beast|bestiary|type=beast} or {@filter Plant|bestiary|type=plant} creature.

subclassFeature.name: Dampen Elements
entries: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison or Thunder damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to grant {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the creature against that instance of the damage.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Nature
entries: You can use your {@subclassFeature Nature's Influence|Cleric|XPHB|Nature|RTReestablished|3} feature without expending a use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2}. When you cast {@spell Suggestion|XPHB} using this feature, the spell does not require {@condition Concentration|XPHB} if the target is a {@filter Beast|bestiary|type=beast} or {@filter Plant|bestiary|type=plant} creature.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Order Domain
entries: {@i Enforce the Discipline of Order}

The Order Domain embodies discipline, adherence to societal norms, and strict obedience to laws. Clerics of this domain focus on upholding and enforcing laws, valuing order and hierarchy above individual desires or emotional influences. They are dedicated to maintaining the structure and security that laws provide, often aligning with institutions or deities that emphasize law and control.

On various worlds, gods associated with this domain represent order and authority, guiding their followers to prioritize obedience and the established rules of society. Clerics in this domain are concerned with adherence to laws and procedures, shaping a stable and organized environment in a chaotic multiverse.

subclassFeature.name: Order Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Order Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Order Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Heroism|XPHB}, {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}, {@spell Zone of Truth|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Voice of Authority
entries: You are ready to assume the chain of command.

items.name: Attack Order
items.entry: You can invoke the power of law to drive an ally to attack. If you cast a spell using a spell slot that targets an ally, that ally can immediately take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} after the spell to make one weapon attack against a creature of your choice that you can see. If the spell targets more than one ally, you choose the ally who can make the attack.

items.name: Forged Leadership
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Order's Demand
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} to exert an intimidating presence over others. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you present your {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB}, and each creature of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed} condition until the end of your next turn or until the Charmed creature takes any damage. You can also cause any of the Charmed creatures to drop what they are holding when they fail the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Embodiment of the Law
entries: You have become remarkably adept at channeling magical energy to compel others.

When you cast an {@filter Enchantment spell of level 1+|spells|school=E|level=1;2;3;4;5;6;7;8;9}, you can change the spell's casting time to a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} for this casting, provided the spell's casting time is normally an Action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Order's Wrath
entries: Enemies you designate for destruction wilt under the combined efforts of you and your allies. If you deal damage with a weapon or cantrip to a creature on your turn, you can curse that creature until the start of your next turn. The next attack that deals damage to that creature, deals an additional {@damage 2d8} Psychic damage. You can only curse one creature per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Peace Domain
entries: {@i Guide Hearts Toward Understanding}

The essence of peace is central to harmonious communities, allied nations, and compassionate souls. Gods of the Peace Domain urge their followers to resolve conflicts and challenge those who disrupt harmony. These deities are honored by those seeking to uphold unity and promote tranquility.

Clerics of the Peace Domain mediate disputes, oversee treaties, and foster understanding among different parties. Their blessings unite people, encouraging support and cooperation, while their magic empowers those who champion peace. They actively work to cultivate a world where peace can thrive, guiding others toward harmony and respect.

subclassFeature.name: Peace Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Peace Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Peace Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Aura of Purity|XPHB}, {@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Implement of Peace
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Emboldening Bond
entries: You can forge an empowering bond among people who are at peace with one another.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose a number of willing creatures within 30 feet of you (this can include yourself) equal to your Wisdom Modifier (minimum of 2). You create a magical bond among them for 1 minute or until you use this feature again. While a bonded creature is within 30 feet of another bonded creature and fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, it can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the result.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Balm of Peace
entries: You make your very presence a soothing balm. As a {action Magic|XPHB} action, you expend a use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2}. When you do, you can move up to your Speed, without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}, and when you move within 5 feet of any other creature during this action, you can restore a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to that creature equal to {@dice 2d6} plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). A creature can receive this healing only once whenever you take this action.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Bond
entries: The bond you forge between people helps them protect each other. When a creature affected by your {@subclassFeature Emboldening Bond|Cleric|XPHB|Peace|RTReestablished|3} feature is about to take damage, a second bonded creature within 30 feet of the first can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the first creature. The second creature then takes all the damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Expansive Bond
entries: The benefits of your {@subclassFeature Emboldening Bond|Cleric|XPHB|Peace|RTReestablished|3} and {@subclassFeature Protective Bond|Cleric|XPHB|Peace|RTReestablished|6} features now work when the creatures are within 60 feet of each other. Moreover, when a creature uses Protective Bond to take someone else's damage, the creature has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tempest Domain
entries: {@i Channel the Thunderous Might of the Divine}

Tempest Domain gods control the wild forces of nature, like storms, seas, and skies, wielding lightning, thunder, and natural disasters. They embody strength, courage, and destruction, sometimes overseeing other deities and delivering justice through thunderbolts. In seafaring cultures, they’re revered as ocean protectors and guardians of sailors.

Clerics of the Tempest Domain inspire awe and respect for storm gods, reminding mortals of their power and the delicate balance between favor and wrath. They promote sacrifices to appease the gods and prevent their divine anger.

subclassFeature.name: Tempest Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Tempest Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Tempest Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}, {@spell Shatter|XPHB}, {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Wrath
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} to wield the power of the storm with unchecked ferocity. When you roll Lightning or Thunder damage, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Storm
entries: You can thunderously rebuke attackers. When a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes Lightning or Thunder (your choice) damage equal to {@damage 1d8} plus your Cleric level on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderous Strike
entries: When you deal Lightning or Thunder damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can also push it up to 10 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Stormcalled
entries: The winds of the tempest lift your form into the air. You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed and can hover.

subclassFeature.name: Twilight Domain
entries: {@i Hold the Line Between Light and Darkness}

The twilight hours mark a gentle shift from day to night, a time of peace when work ceases and rest begins. Yet, this period also borders on darkness, which can conceal both comfort and dread. The gods of twilight guard against the horrors of the night.

Clerics of the Twilight Domain are guardians of this delicate transition, offering solace to those who seek rest and venturing into the deepening night to ensure safety and serenity. Their presence assures that twilight remains a time of calm rather than a prelude to fear.

subclassFeature.name: Twilight Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Twilight Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Twilight Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB}, {@spell Moonbeam|XPHB}, {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}
{@spell Aura of Vitality|XPHB}, {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of Night
entries: The night has taught you to be vigilant, allowing you and your allies to see through the deepest gloom.

items.name: Darkvision
items.entry: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Darkvision Share
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can magically share the darkvision of this feature with willing creatures you can see within 10 feet of you, up to a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one creature). The shared darkvision lasts for 1 hour. Once you share it, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a spell slot to share it again.

items.name: Vigilant Blessing
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you give one creature you touch (including possibly yourself) {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} roll the creature makes. This benefit ends immediately after the roll or if you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Twilight Sanctuary
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2} to refresh your allies with soothing twilight. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you present your {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB}, and a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation|XPHB} of dim light appears around you. It lasts for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or die.

items.name: Moon Guard
items.entry: When you activate this feature, creatures of your choice within the Emanation gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Cleric level.

items.name: Night Will
items.entry: While active, creatures of your choice within the Emanation have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition on them.

subclassFeature.name: Steps of Night
entries: You can draw on the mystical power of night to rise into the air. When you are in dim light or darkness you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to give yourself a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed for 1 minute. You can do so as part of the same Bonus Action you use to activate {@subclassFeature Twilight Sanctuary|Cleric|XPHB|Twilight|RTReestablished|3}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Twilight Shroud
