entries: The twilight that you summon offers a protective embrace: you and your allies have {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} while in the sphere created by your {@subclassFeature Twilight Sanctuary|Cleric|XPHB|Twilight|RTReestablished|3}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Dreams
entries: {@i Traverse the Twilight Between Sleep and Wakefulness}

The Circle of Dreams draws its power from the ethereal connection between the waking world and the Feywild’s dreamlike realms. Druids of this circle are guardians of places where the veil between reality and dreams is thin. They intertwine their magic with the shimmering essence of dreams, soothing the troubled, healing the wounded, and filling the world with a sense of serene wonder. In the lands they protect, the boundary between dream and reality blurs, creating sanctuaries of beauty and rest where all can find peace and renewal.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Dreams Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of Dreams Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Circle of Dreams Spells
rows: {@spell Faerie Fire|XPHB}, {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Balm of the Summer Court
entries: You are imbued with the vibrant energies of the Summer Court. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|XPHB|2} feature to create a reservoir of healing fey power within yourself. This reservoir is represented by a number of {@dice d6}s equal to half your Druid level (rounded up). These dice last until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or until you use this action again.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can target a creature you can see within 120 feet of you and spend any number of these dice. Roll the spent dice and add them together. The target regains a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total. The target also gains 1 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB|Temporary Hit Point} per die spent.

subclassFeature.name: Hearth of Moonlight and Shadow
entries: When you and your allies take a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} within the dome created by your {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|XPHB} spell, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Short Rest
items.entry: When a creature regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} by spending {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Dice} at the end of a Short Rest within the dome, the minimum number of hit points it regains from each roll is equal to your Wisdom modifier.

items.name: Long Rest
items.entry: When a creature ends a Long Rest within the dome, it gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Paths
entries: You can use the hidden, magical pathways that some fey use to traverse space in the blink of an eye. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can use this feature in one of the following ways:

items.name: Free Step
items.entry: You cast the {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot. You can cast it without Verbal components.

items.name: Friendly Step
items.entry: You teleport one willing creature you touch up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Walker in Dreams
entries: The magic of the Feywild grants you the ability to travel mentally or physically through dreamlands.

You can cast the following spells without expending a spell slot or requiring Material components: {@spell Dream|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB} or {@spell Teleportation Circle|XPHB}. Once you cast one of these spells without a spell slot, you cannot cast any of them in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Additionally, when you finish a Long Rest within the dome created by your {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|XPHB} spell, you can designate your current location as an anchor point. This anchor point remains until you designate a new one, and you can use it as the destination for your Teleportation Circle spell instead of a permanent circle. If you attempt to cast Teleportation Circle using your anchor point as the destination while you are on a different plane of existence, the spell fails but the spell slot isn't expended.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Shepherd
entries: {@i Commune with the Spirits of Beast and Fey}

Druids of the Circle of the Shepherd are the protectors and champions of the wild’s most vulnerable creatures. They form deep connections with nature spirits, particularly those of beasts and fey. Shepherds see themselves as guardians, striving to keep the natural world in balance. They defend creatures unable to fend for themselves against predators, both monstrous and human, and work to preserve the sacred spaces of the fey. Often living far from civilization, these druids find solace among the creatures they protect, harmonizing with the wild spirits that accompany them.

subclassFeature.name: Speech of the Woods
entries: You always have the {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} and {@spell Summon Beast|XPHB} spells prepared.

You can cast Speak with Animals without expending a spell slot, and you can cast Summon Beast once without expending a spell slot or needing Material components. Once you cast Summon Beast this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
In addition, you learn Sylvan, or one other language of your choice if you already know it.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Totem
entries: You can call forth nature spirits to influence the world around you. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|XPHB|2} feature to magically summon an intangible spirit to a point you can see within 60 feet of you. The spirit creates an aura in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} around itself. It counts as neither a creature nor an object, though it has the spectral appearance of the creature it represents. As a Bonus Action, you can move the spirit up to 60 feet to a point you can see.
The spirit persists for 1 minute and ends early if you're {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} or if you use this feature again.
The effect of the spirit's aura depends on the type of spirit you summon from the options below.

items.name: Bear Spirit
items.entry: The bear spirit grants you and your allies its might and endurance. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to grant it {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 5 plus your Druid level. In addition, you and your allies have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and Strength saving throws while within the aura.

items.name: Hawk Spirit
items.entry: The hawk spirit is a consummate hunter, aiding you and your allies with its keen sight. When a creature within the spirit's aura makes an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to grant it {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on that attack roll, and any other attack it makes before the start of your next turn. In addition, you and your allies have Advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks while in the aura.

items.name: Unicorn Spirit
items.entry: The unicorn spirit lends its protection to those nearby. When a creature in the aura casts a spell using a spell slot that restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to any creature inside or outside the aura, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to increase the number of Hit Points one target regained by an amount equal to 5 plus your Druid level. In addition, you and your allies gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against poison while in the aura.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Summoner
entries: When you summon Beasts or Fey, they gain additional power and resilience. When you cast the {@spell Summon Beast|XPHB} or {@spell Summon Fey|XPHB} spell, the summoned creature gains the following benefits:

items.name: Increased Resilience
items.entry: The creature appears with more {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} than normal: 5 extra Hit Points per level of the spell that summoned it.

items.name: Magical Attacks
items.entry: When the creature hits with an attack, you can choose for it to use its normal damage type or Radiant damage. You make this choice each time the creature hits with an attack.

entries: In addition, you always have the Summon Fey spell prepared, and can cast Summon Fey once without expending a spell slot or needing Material components. Once you cast Summon Fey this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Spirit
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Spirit Totem|Druid|XPHB|Shepherd|RTReestablished|3} safeguards the Beasts and Fey that you call forth with your magic. If a creature summoned by your {@spell Summon Beast|XPHB} or {@spell Summon Fey|XPHB} spells ends its turn inside your Spirit Totem aura, it regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Druid level.

subclassFeature.name: Faithful Summons
entries: The nature spirits you commune with protect you when you are the most defenseless. If you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition against your will, you can immediately gain the benefits of {@spell Summon Beast|XPHB} as if you had cast it using a level 9 spell slot. The summoned Beast appears within 20 feet of you. If it receives no commands from you, it protects you from harm and attacks your foes. This casting of the spell does not require {@condition Concentration|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Spores
entries: {@i Turn Life's Last Breath into Nature's First Step}
Druids of the Circle of Spores find beauty in decay. They see within mold and other fungi the ability to transform lifeless material into abundant, albeit somewhat strange, life.

These druids believe that life and death are parts of a grand cycle, with one leading to the other and then back again. Death isn’t the end of life, but instead a change of state that sees life shift into a new form.

Druids of this circle have a complex relationship with the undead. Unlike most other druids, they see nothing inherently wrong with undeath, which they consider to be a companion to life and death. But these druids believe that the natural cycle is healthiest when each segment of it is vibrant and changing. Undead that seek to replace all life with undeath, or that try to avoid passing to a final rest, violate the cycle and must be thwarted.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Spores Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of Spores Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Circle of Spores Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Blindness/Deafness|XPHB}, {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB}, {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Halo of Spores
entries: You are surrounded by invisible, necrotic spores that are harmless until you unleash them on a creature nearby. When a creature you can see moves into a space within 10 feet of you or starts its turn there, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC (no action required) or take {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage. Once you deal this damage, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.
The Necrotic damage increases to {@damage 1d6} at level 6, {@damage 1d8} at level 10, and {@damage 1d10} at level 14.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Entity
entries: You gain the ability to channel magic into your spores. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|XPHB|2} feature to awaken those spores, rather than transforming into a beast form. While this feature is active, you gain the following benefits for 10 minutes or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition:

items.name: Temporary Hit Points
items.entry: When you enter the form, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to four times your Druid level, which go away when the form ends.

items.name: Halo of Spores Improvement
items.entry: When you deal your {@subclassFeature Halo of Spores|Druid|XPHB|Spores|RTReestablished|3} damage, roll the die a second time and add it to the total.

items.name: Spore Strikes
items.entry: Your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Fungal Infestation
entries: When a creature with an organic corpse dies within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to infest it with spores, briefly reanimating it in a final surge of aggression.

items.name: Fungal Puppet
items.entry: The corpse immediately moves up to 20 feet walking. You then make a melee spell attack against a target of your choice as if you were in the corpse's space, though you must use your own senses.

items.name: Damage
items.entry: On a hit, the attack deals {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage plus your Wisdom modifier.

entries: You can use this Reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Spreading Spores
entries: You gain the ability to seed an area with deadly spores. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while your {@subclassFeature Symbiotic Entity|Druid|XPHB|Spores|RTReestablished|3} feature is active, you can hurl spores up to 30 feet away, where they swirl in a 10-foot Cube for 1 minute. The spores disappear early if you use this feature again, if you dismiss them as a Bonus Action, or if your Symbiotic Entity feature is no longer active.

If a creature is within the area when you create it, or if it enters the area or ends its turn there, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or take your {@subclassFeature Halo of Spores|Druid|XPHB|Spores|RTReestablished|3} damage.
While the Cube of spores persists, you can't use your Halo of Spores feature.

subclassFeature.name: Fungal Body
entries: The fungal spores in your body alter you. You gain the following benefits while you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Condition Immunity
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB} and {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} conditions.

items.name: Critical Hit Immunity
items.entry: Any Critical Hit against you counts as a normal hit instead.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Wildfire
entries: {@i Create Life from the Ashes of Destruction}

Druids of the Circle of Wildfire embrace the transformative power of fire, understanding that destruction often clears the way for new growth. They form a bond with a primal spirit of fire, harnessing its dual nature to wield flames that consume and rejuvenate in equal measure. These druids command controlled infernos that can raze the old to make room for the new, balancing the fierce blaze of destruction with the gentle promise of rebirth.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Wildfire Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of Wildfire Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Circle of Wildfire Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB}, {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Flaming Sphere|XPHB}, {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Summon Wildfire Spirit
entries: You can summon the primal spirit bound to your soul. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|XPHB|2} feature to summon your {@creature Wildfire Spirit|RTReestablished}, rather than assuming a beast form.

items.name: Spirit Apparition
items.entry: The Spirit appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature within 10 feet of the Spirit (other than you) when it appears must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 2d6} Fire damage.

items.name: Statistics
items.entry: The Spirit is {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} to you and your companions and obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Wildfire Spirit stat block, which uses your Wisdom modifier in several places. You determine the spirit's appearance. Some spirits take the form of a humanoid figure made of gnarled branches covered in flame, while others look like beasts wreathed in fire.

items.name: Combat
items.entry: In combat, the Spirit shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. The only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, the spirit can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

items.name: Duration
items.entry: The spirit manifests for 1 hour, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, until you use this feature to summon the Spirit again, or until you die.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Bond
entries: The bond with your {@creature Wildfire Spirit|RTReestablished} enhances your destructive and restorative spells. Whenever you cast a spell that deals Fire damage or restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} while your Wildfire Spirit is summoned, roll a {@dice d8}, and you gain a bonus equal to the number rolled to one damage or healing roll of the spell.
In addition, when you cast a spell with a range other than self, the spell can originate from you or your Wildfire Spirit.

subclassFeature.name: Cauterizing Flames
entries: You gain the ability to turn death into magical flames that can heal or incinerate. When a Small or larger creature dies within 30 feet of you or your {@creature Wildfire Spirit|RTReestablished}, a harmless spectral flame springs forth in the dead creature's space and flickers there for 1 minute. When a creature you can see enters that space, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to extinguish the spectral flame there and either heal the creature or deal Fire damage to it. The healing or damage equals {@dice 2d10} + your Wisdom modifier.
You can use this Reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Blazing Revival
entries: The bond with your {@creature Wildfire Spirit|RTReestablished} can save you from death. If the spirit is within 120 feet of you when you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and thereby have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition, you can cause the spirit to drop to 0 Hit Points. You then regain half your Hit Points and immediately rise to your feet.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer
entries: {@i Wield Magic and Precision in Every Shot}

Arcane Archers are masters of an ancient elven art, blending archery with arcane power to create devastating magical attacks. They stand as protectors at the fringes of elven lands, firing enchanted arrows from afar to vanquish threats before they can reach their homeland. Over time, this formidable discipline has spread beyond the elven realms, allowing warriors of various races to combine magic and archery, striking down enemies with deadly precision and mystical force.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer Lore
entries: You learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature—typical for practitioners of this elven martial tradition. You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in the {@skill Arcana|XPHB} or the {@skill Nature|XPHB} skill. Also, you learn the {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} or {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB} cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for it.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot
entries: You learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. You learn two Arcane Shots of your choice (see "Arcane Shot Options" below). You learn an extra Arcane Shot of your choice when you reach level 7, and again at level 10, at level 15, and level 18. The damage of all Arcane Shots increases at level 10 and level 18.

Once per {@action Attack|XPHB} action, when you fire an arrow from a {@item Shortbow|XPHB} or {@item Longbow|XPHB}, you can apply one of your Arcane Shot options to that arrow. You decide to use the option when the arrow hits a creature, unless the option doesn't involve an attack roll.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Shot Options
entries: The {@subclassFeature Arcane Shot|Fighter|XPHB|Arcane Archer|RTReestablished|3} feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical order. They are all magical effects, and each one is associated with one of the schools of magic.
If an option requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

items.name: Banishing Arrow
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild. The creature hit by the arrow must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's Speed is 0, and has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
At level 10, the target also takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Force damage when the arrow hits it. This damage increases to {@damage 2d6} at level 18.

items.name: Beguiling Arrow
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this projectile to temporarily beguile its target. Choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage and makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn, with the chosen ally as the source.
The Psychic damage increases by {@damage 1d6} at level 10 ({@damage 3d6}) and at level 18 ({@damage 4d6}).

items.name: Bursting Arrow
entries: You imbue your arrow with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@damage 2d6} Force damage each.
The Force damage increases by {@damage 1d6} at level 10 ({@damage 3d6}) and at level 18 ({@damage 4d6}).

items.name: Enfeebling Arrow
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your arrow. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or all damage dealt by the target is halved until the start of your next turn.
The Necrotic damage increases by {@damage 1d6} at level 10 ({@damage 3d6}) and at level 18 ({@damage 4d6}).

items.name: Grasping Arrow
entries: When this projectile strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Poison damage and its Speed is reduced by 10 feet. The first time it moves on its turn without teleporting, it takes {@damage 2d6} Slashing damage. The target or a creature within reach of it can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.
The Poison damage and Slashing damage both increase by {@damage 1d6} at level 10 ({@damage 3d6}) and at level 18 ({@damage 4d6}).

items.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your arrow an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 60 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The extra Piercing damage increases by {@damage 1d6} at level 10 ({@damage 2d6}) and at level 18 ({@damage 3d6}).

items.name: Seeking Arrow
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your arrow the ability to seek out a target. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The arrow flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Three-Quarters Cover} and {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover}. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Otherwise, the arrow disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The extra Force damage increases by {@damage 1d6} at level 10 ({@damage 2d6}) and at level 18 ({@damage 3d6}).

items.name: Shadow Arrow
entries: You weave illusion magic into your projectile, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with shadows. The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn.
The Psychic damage increases by {@damage 1d6} at level 10 ({@damage 3d6}) and at level 18 ({@damage 4d6}).

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Shot
entries: You gain the ability to infuse your arrows with magical energy.

items.name: Magic Arrow
items.entry: Whenever you attack with a {@item Shortbow|XPHB} or {@item Longbow|XPHB}, you can choose to deal the weapon's damage type or Force damage.

items.name: Curved Shot
items.entry: When you attack with a {@item Shortbow|XPHB} or {@item Longbow|XPHB} and miss, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

subclassFeature.name: Overwatch
entries: When a creature you can see first enters a space within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a ranged attack against it using a {@item Shortbow|XPHB} or {@item Longbow|XPHB} that you are wielding.

subclassFeature.name: Ever-Ready Shot
entries: If you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and are missing any uses of your {@subclassFeature Arcane Shot|Fighter|XPHB|Arcane Archer|RTReestablished|3}, you regain one use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Tipped
entries: When you hit a creature with a ranged attack using a {@item Shortbow|XPHB} or {@item Longbow|XPHB}, you can deal extra damage to the target equal to your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Banneret
entries: {@i Stand Firm, and Others Will Stand with You}

Bannerets are noble knights-errant who roam the land, sworn to uphold justice and defend the weak. They are not tied to any single kingdom but dedicate themselves to a higher cause, traveling wherever they are needed. Their presence alone inspires courage in allies and pause to their enemies. More than skilled fighters, they are leaders who, through their valor, can turn untrained soldiers into disciplined forces. In battle, their bravery ignites a spark in their comrades, empowering them to face challenges they once thought impossible.

subclassFeature.name: Rallying Cry
entries: You learn how to inspire your allies to fight on past their injuries. When you use your {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter|XPHB|1} feature, you can choose up to three creatures within 60 feet of you that are allied with you. Each one regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Fighter level, provided that the creature can see or hear you.
Starting at 5th level, affected allies can also inmediatly move up to half their Speed without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Royal Envoy
entries: Knights of high standing are expected to conduct themselves with grace.

items.name: Bonus Proficiencies
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in the {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skill. If you are already proficient in it, you gain Proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}, {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, or {@skill Performance|XPHB}.

items.name: Expertise
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} skill.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Surge
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Action Surge|Fighter|XPHB|2} feature, you can choose one ally within 60 feet of you. That creature can immediately take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, provided that it can see or hear you.

subclassFeature.name: Commanding Guidance
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can cause the next attack roll made by an ally against that creature to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} before the end of your next turn. You may only use this feature once on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark
entries: You can extend the benefit of your {@classFeature Indomitable|Fighter|XPHB|9} feature to an ally.

When you decide to use your Indomitable feature to reroll a saving throw and you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition, you can choose one ally within 60 feet of you that also failed its saving throw against the same effect. As long as that creature can see or hear you, it can reroll its saving throw and must use the new roll. This roll has a bonus equal to your Fighter level.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Inspiring Surge
entries: You can choose two allies within 60 feet of you to affect with your {@subclassFeature Inspiring Surge|Fighter|XPHB|Banneret|RTReestablished|7}, rather than one.

subclassFeature.name: Cavalier
entries: {@i Ride with Purpose, Guard with Pride}

Cavaliers are masters of mounted combat, trained from an early age in the art of riding with precision and grace. Often from noble backgrounds, they are equally skilled in leading cavalry charges and navigating courtly diplomacy. However, their true calling lies in protecting others, whether it’s safeguarding a noble or defending the innocent. Driven by honor and justice, many Cavaliers leave behind privileged lives to pursue adventure, where they can uphold their ideals and prove their worth in battle, their loyalty to those they protect being their greatest strength.

subclassFeature.name: Cavalry Training
entries: You are trained in mounted combat and the responsibilities that come with it.

items.name: Stablemaster
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in the {@skill Animal Handling|XPHB} skill and one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Insight|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}.

items.name: Saddleborne
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saves made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and descend no more than 10 feet, you can land on your feet if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Quick Mount
items.entry: Mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your Speed.

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering Mark
entries: You can menace your foes, foiling their attacks and punishing them for harming others.

items.name: Taunt
items.entry: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can mark the creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, if you die, or if someone else uses this feature on the same creature. While it is within the reach of your weapon, a creature marked by you has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on any attack roll that doesn't target you.

items.name: Punish
items.entry: If a creature marked by you deals damage to anyone other than you, you can make a special melee attack against the marked creature as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your next turn. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll, and if it hits it deals extra damage equal to half your Fighter level. You can make this special attack a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Maneuver
entries: You learn to fend off strikes directed at you, your mount, or other creatures nearby. If you or a creature you can see within the reach of your meelee weapon is hit by an attack, you can roll {@dice 1d8} as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and add the number rolled to the target's {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} until the start of their next turn. If the triggering attack still hits, the target has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} against the attack's damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of 1).
You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hold the Line
entries: You become a master of locking down your enemies. Creatures provoke an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from you when they move 5+ feet while within your reach, and if you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, the target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: You can run down your foes, whether you're mounted or not. Once per turn when you move 10+ feet in a straight line right before making an attack with a melee weapon, you can activate the {@itemMastery Graze|XPHB} or {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB} mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you’re using with that weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Defender
entries: You respond to danger with extraordinary vigilance. In combat, you get a special {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} that you can take once on every creature's turn, except your own. You can use this special Reaction only to make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, and you can't use it on the same turn that you take your normal Reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Echo Knight
entries: {@i Multiple Futures Converge in Every Attack}

Echo Knights are warriors who wield the enigmatic power of dunamis, a force that bends time and reality. They conjure echoes—shadowy figures from alternate timelines—to fight alongside them, creating a flurry of attacks and confusion on the battlefield. Each echo represents a different potential future or a past that never was, allowing the Echo Knight to strike from multiple angles simultaneously. Feared for their ability to appear in numerous places at once, Echo Knights are relentless and unpredictable, using their mastery of time manipulation to outmaneuver and overwhelm their foes, presenting enemies with a legion of possibilities rather than a single opponent.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Echo
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to magically manifest an echo of yourself in an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you. It is a magical, translucent, gray image of you that lasts until it is destroyed, until you dismiss it as a Bonus Action, until you manifest another echo, or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

Your echo is considered an object, but uses your game statistics, except it has an {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equal to 13 plus your Constitution modifier, 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all conditions. On your turn, you can mentally command the echo to move in any direction (no action required). If your echo is ever more than 30 feet from you at the end of your turn, it is destroyed.
You can use the echo in the following ways:

items.name: Swap
items.entry: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, magically swap places with your echo at a cost of 15 feet of your movement, regardless of the distance between the two of you.

items.name: Echo Attack
items.entry: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, any attack you make can originate from your space or the echo's space. You make this choice for each attack.

items.name: Opportunity Attack
items.entry: You can make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against enemies as if you are in your echo’s space. This attack originates from the echo’s space.

subclassFeature.name: Unleash Incarnation
entries: You can heighten your echo's fury. Whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can make one additional attack from the echo's position.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Echo Avatar
entries: You can temporarily transfer your consciousness to your echo. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can see through your echo's eyes and hear through its ears. During this time, you have the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} and {@condition Blinded|XPHB} conditions. This effect lasts for 10 minutes or until you end it early (no action required). While using this feature, your echo can be up to 1,000 feet away from you without it being destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Martyr
entries: You can make your echo throw itself in front of an attack directed at another creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. Before the attack roll is made, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport the echo to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the targeted creature. The attack roll that triggered the Reaction is instead made against your echo.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Reclaim Potential
entries: You've learned to absorb the fleeting magic of your echo. When an echo of yours is destroyed by taking damage, you can gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Constitution modifier.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Legion of One
entries: Your summoning powers have grown more potent.

items.name: Endless Echoes
items.entry: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} and are missing any uses of your {@subclassFeature Unleash Incarnation|Fighter|XPHB|Echo Knight|RTReestablished|3} feature, you regain one use of it.

items.name: Echo of an Echo
items.entry: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to create two echos with your {@subclassFeature Manifest Echo|Fighter|XPHB|Echo Knight|RTReestablished|3} feature, and these echoes can co-exist. If you try to create a third echo, the previous two echoes are destroyed. Anything you can do from one echo's position can be done from the other's instead.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Knight
entries: {@i Giant Inscriptions Turn the Tide of Battle}

Rune Knights harness ancient runic power to elevate their combat prowess, drawing from the mystical traditions of giants. By inscribing runes onto their weapons and armor, they infuse their gear with supernatural abilities, which may come from ancient scripts, sage teachings, or direct instruction from giant artisans. These runes bestow extraordinary powers, turning their equipment into magical conduits that amplify their strength and resilience. As they inscribe more runes, Rune Knights merge the colossal might of giants with their own battle-hardened skill, becoming formidable and magical warriors.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Carver
entries: You can use magic runes to enhance your gear.

items.name: Inscription Equipment
items.entry: You gain a set of {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} and you have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with it. You also learn to speak, read and write {@language Giant|XPHB}; or another language if your already know Giant.

items.name: Learning Runes
items.entry: You learn two Runes of your choice (see "Rune Magic Options" below), from among the Runes described below, and each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace one Rune you know with a different one from this feature. You learn an additional Rune when you reach certain levels in this class: level 7 (3 runes), level 10 (4 runes) and level 15 (5 runes).

items.name: Inscribing Runes
items.entry: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can touch a number of objects equal to the number of Runes you know, and you inscribe a different Rune onto each of the objects. To be eligible, an object must be a {@filter Weapon|items|type=melee weapon;ranged weapon}, a {@filter suit of Armor|items|type=light armor;medium armor;heavy armor}, a {@filter Shield|items|type=shield}, a piece of jewelry, or something else you can wear or hold in a hand. Your Rune remains on an object until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, and an object can bear only one of your Runes at a time.

entries: A Rune can be invoked for an effect detailed in its description, once you do so, you can't invoke the same Rune again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Magic Options
entries: The {@subclassFeature Rune Carver|Fighter|XPHB|Rune Knight|RTReestablished|3} feature lets you choose options for it at certain levels. The options are presented here in alphabetical and level order. The following Runes are available to you when you learn a Rune. If a Rune has a level requirement, you must be at least that level in this class to learn the Rune. If a Rune requires a saving throw, your Rune Magic save DC equals 8 plus your Constitution modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

items.name: Cloud Rune.
entries: This Rune emulates the deceptive magic used by some cloud giants.

items: While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this Rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand|XPHB}) checks and Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) checks.

When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to invoke the Rune and choose a different creature within 30 feet of you, other than the attacker. The chosen creature becomes the target of the attack, using the same roll. This magic can transfer the attack's effects regardless of the attack's range.

items.name: Fire Rune
entries: This Rune's magic channels the masterful craftsmanship of great smiths.

items: While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this Rune, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice. You choose the tool proficiency when you inscribe this Rune.

When you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon, you can invoke the Rune to summon fiery shackles: the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Fire damage, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. While Restrained by the shackles, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the shackles on a success.

items.name: Frost Rune
entries: This Rune's magic evokes the might of those who survive in the wintry wilderness, such as frost giants.

items: While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this Rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling|XPHB}) checks and Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB}) checks.

You can invoke the Rune as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to increase your sturdiness. For 10 minutes, you gain a +2 bonus to all ability checks and saving throws that use your Strength or Constitution.

items.name: Stone Rune
entries: This Rune's magic channels the judiciousness associated with stone giants.

items: While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks, and you have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 120 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.

When a creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to invoke the Rune and force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. While Charmed, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and a Speed of 0, descending into a dreamy stupor. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Hill Rune (Level 7 or Higher)
entries: This Rune's magic bestows a resilience reminiscent of a hill giant.

items: While wearing or carrying an object that bears this Rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saves to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} against Poison damage.
You can invoke the Rune as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, gaining {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage for 1 minute.

items.name: Storm Rune (Level 7 or Higher)
entries: Using this rune, you can glimpse the future like a storm giant seer.

items: While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this Rune, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) checks and {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

You can invoke the Rune as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to enter a prophetic state for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Until the state ends, when you or another creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cause the roll to have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} or {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Giant's Might
entries: You have learned how to imbue yourself with the might of giants. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you magically gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items.name: Large Sized
items.entry: If you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If you lack the room to become Large, your size doesn't change.

items.name: Giant's Strength
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

items.name: Gigantic Force
items.entry: Once per turn, when you make an attack using a weapon or an Unarmed Strike you can add an extra {@damage 1d6} damage to the attack’s damage roll.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Shield
entries: You learn to invoke your rune magic to protect your allies. When another creature you can see within 60 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the attacker to reroll that attack.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Great Stature
entries: The magic of your runes permanently alters you.

items.name: Growth
items.entry: When you gain this feature, roll {@dice 3d4}. You grow a number of inches in height equal to the roll.

items.name: Colossal Force
items.entry: The extra damage you deal with your {@subclassFeature Giant's Might|Fighter|XPHB|Rune Knight|RTReestablished|3} feature increases to {@dice 1d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Runes
entries: You can invoke each Rune you know from your {@subclassFeature Rune Carver|Fighter|XPHB|Rune Knight|RTReestablished|3} feature twice, rather than once, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Juggernaut
entries: You learn how to amplify your rune-powered transformation.

items.name: Titan Sized
items.entry: When you use {@subclassFeature Giant's Might|Fighter|XPHB|Rune Knight|RTReestablished|3}, your size can increase to Huge. When you do, your reach increases by 5 feet for the duration.

items.name: Titanic Force
items.entry: The extra damage you deal with the {@subclassFeature Giant's Might|Fighter|XPHB|Rune Knight|RTReestablished|3} feature increases to {@damage 1d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Samurai
entries: {@i Victory is the Only Option for an Indomitable Spirit}

The Samurai is a warrior driven by an unyielding spirit and a code of honor. Harnessing a steadfast resolve, the Samurai faces foes with unwavering determination. Those who stand against a Samurai are confronted with a choice: surrender to the indomitable will or face the full force of an unbreakable fighter. With every battle, the Samurai embodies the pinnacle of disciplined combat and relentless pursuit of victory.

subclassFeature.name: Brush and Blade
entries: You have forged your mettle throughout your training.

items.name: Brush
items.entry: You gain a set of {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} and you have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in it.

items.name: Skill
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. Alternatively, you learn one {@filter language|languages} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: Your intensity in battle can shield you and help you strike true. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, you can give yourself {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls made with weapons until the start of your next turn. When you do so, you also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Fighter level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Elegant Courtier
entries: Your discipline and attention to detail allow you to excel in social situations.

items.name: Well Mannered
items.entry: Whenever you make a {@skill Persuasion|XPHB} check, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the result.

items.name: Self Control
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this Proficiency, you instead have Proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Tireless Spirit
entries: When you roll Initiative and are missing any uses of your {@subclassFeature Fighting Spirit|Fighter|XPHB|Samurai|RTReestablished|3} feature, you regain one use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Strike
entries: You learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on an attack roll against one of the targets, you can forgo the Advantage for that roll to make an additional weapon attack against that target, as part of the same action. You can do so no more than once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Strength before Death
entries: Your fighting spirit can delay the grasp of death. If you take damage that reduces you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't kill you outright, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to immediately take an extra turn, interrupting the current turn. While you have 0 Hit Points during that extra turn, taking damage causes {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures as normal, and three Death Saving Throw failures can still kill you. When the extra turn ends, you have the Unconscious condition if you still have 0 Hit Points.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Ascendant Dragon
entries: {@i The Spirit of the Dragon Fuels Every Strike}

Warriors of the Ascendant Dragon channel the primal power of dragons, blending their disciplined martial prowess with draconic majesty and might. By attuning to draconic energy, they gain abilities such as breath weapons, flight, and the power to fortify their allies. Whether their power comes from direct contact with a dragon, ancient teachings, or meditation near dragon lairs, these monks seek spiritual harmony with the world’s elemental forces, drawing strength from the magic and mysticism of dragons.

entries.caption: Ascendant Dragon Origin
rows: You honed your abilities by aligning your spirit with a dragon’s world-altering power.
A dragon personally took an active role in shaping your inner energy.
You studied at a monastery that traces its teachings back centuries or more to a single dragon’s instruction, or one that is devoted to a dragon god.
You spent long stretches meditating in the region around an ancient dragon’s lair, absorbing that lair’s ambient magic.
You found a scroll written in Draconic that contained inspiring new techniques.
After a dream featuring a five-handed dragonborn, you awoke with the mystical breath of dragons.

subclassFeature.name: Breath of the Dragon
entries: You can channel destructive waves of energy, like those created by the dragons you emulate. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one attack with an exhalation of draconic energy in either a 20-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide (your choice). Choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking damage of the chosen type equal to two rolls of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
At 11th level, the damage of this feature increases to three rolls of your Martial Arts die.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. While you have no uses available, you can expend 2 Focus Points to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Disciple
entries: You can channel draconic power to magnify your presence and imbue your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} with the essence of a dragon’s breath. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Draconic Presence
items.entry: If you fail a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}) check, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} die and add it to the result, tapping into the mighty presence of dragons. Once this feature turns a failure into a success, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Draconic Strike
items.entry: When you make an Unarmed Strike, you can change the damage type to Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison.

items.name: Tongue of Dragons
items.entry: You learn to speak, read, and write {@language Draconic|XPHB} or one other language of your choice if you know it already.

subclassFeature.name: Wings Unfurled
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk|XPHB|2}, you can unfurl spectral draconic wings from your back that vanish at the end of your turn. While the wings exist, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Wyrm
entries: The power of your draconic spirit now radiates from you, warding your allies or inspiring fear in your enemies. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can create an {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of draconic power that radiates 10 feet from you for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain one of the following effects of your choice:

items.name: Frightful Presence
items.entry: When you create the Emanation and as a Bonus Action on subsequent turns, you can choose a creature within the Emanation. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened} condition for 1 minute. The target can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

items.name: Resistance
items.entry: Choose a damage type when you activate the Emanation: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. You and your allies within the Emanation have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type.

entries: Once you create the Emanation, you can’t create it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend 3 Focus Points to create it again.

subclassFeature.name: Ascendant Aspect
entries: Your draconic spirit reaches its peak. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Augment Breath
items.entry: When you use your {@subclassFeature Breath of the Dragon|Monk|XPHB|Ascendant Dragon|RTReestablished|3}, you can expend 1 Focus Point to augment its shape and power. The exhalation of draconic energy becomes either a 60-foot Cone or a 90-foot Line that is 5 feet wide (your choice), and each creature in that area takes damage equal to four rolls of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Blindsight
items.entry: You have {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} with a range of 30 feet.

items.name: Explosive Fury
items.entry: When you activate your {@subclassFeature Aspect of the Wyrm|Monk|XPHB|Ascendant Dragon|RTReestablished|11}, draconic fury explodes from you. Choose any number of creatures you can see in your {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Each of those creatures must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage (your choice). The damage is equal to three rolls of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} Die.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Astral Self
entries: {@i Strength is Born From the Soul, not the Flesh}

Warriors of the Astral Self view their physical body as a temporary vessel and believe their true form is an astral self—an ethereal embodiment of their spirit. This translucent form, visible only when summoned, reflects the monk’s soul and varies based on their inner nature. It can represent order, protection, empowerment, or dominance, and may not resemble their physical appearance. As they progress, monks harness their astral self’s power to defend the weak or assert their will, guided by their core motivations and ideals.

entries.subclassFeature: Arms of the Astral Self|Monk|XPHB|Astral Self|RTReestablished|3

subclassFeature.name: Arms of the Astral Self
entries: At the beginning of your turn, you can expend 1 Focus Point to summon your Arms of the Astral Self. When you do so, each creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take Force damage equal to two rolls of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} die.

For 10 minutes, these Arms of the Astral Self hover near your shoulders or surround your arms (your choice). You determine the arms appearance, and they vanish early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, die or choose to dismiss them.
While the Arms of the Astral Self are present, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Mind Over Body
items.entry: You can use your Wisdom modifier in place of your Strength modifier when making Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

items.name: Astral Strikes
items.entry: You can use the spectral arms to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. You can use your Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls of these Unarmed Strikes instead of Strength or Dexterity modifiers, and their damage type is Force. In addition, when you use the Grapple or Shove option of your Unarmed Strike, you can use your Wisdom modifier to determine the DC instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifiers.

items.name: Reach
items.entry: When you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} with the arms on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

items.name: Astral Deflect
items.entry: You can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier for the damage dealt and reduced by your {@classFeature Deflect Attacks|Monk|XPHB|3} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Visage of the Astral Self
entries: When you activate your {@subclassFeature Arms of the Astral Self|Monk|XPHB|Astral Self|RTReestablished|3}, you can also summon the Visage of your Astral Self. This visage covers your face like a helmet or mask. You determine its appearance. It vanishes when your Arms of the Astral Self do.
While the spectral visage is present, you gain the following benefits.

items.name: Astral Sight
items.entry: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

items.name: Wisdom of the Spirit
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) and Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

items.name: Word of the Spirit
items.entry: When you speak, you can direct your words to a creature of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you, making it so only that creature can hear you. Alternatively, you can amplify your voice so that all creatures within 600 feet can hear you.

items.name: Spirit Bypass
items.entry: The {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} made with your Arms of the Astral Self ignore {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Force damage and are not affected by anti-magic fields.

subclassFeature.name: Body of the Astral Self
entries: When you have both your {@subclassFeature Arms of the Astral Self|Monk|XPHB|Astral Self|RTReestablished|3} and your {@subclassFeature Visage of the Astral Self|Monk|XPHB|Astral Self|RTReestablished|6} active, you can cause the body of your Astral Self to appear (no action required). This spectral body envelops your physical form like a suit of armor, connecting with the arms and visage. You determine its appearance.
While the spectral body is present, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Empowered Deflection
items.entry: When you use your {@classFeature Deflect Attacks|Monk|XPHB|3} feature, you can add one additional {@dice d10} to the damage reduced.

items.name: Empowered Arms
items.entry: Once on each of your turns, when you hit a target with the Arms of the Astral Self, you can deal extra damage to the target equal to your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} die.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Astral Self
entries: Your connection to your Astral Self reaches its peak, allowing you to fully unleash its potential. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 4 Focus Points (or 3 Focus Points if your Astral Arms are already active) to summon the arms, visage, and body of your Astral Self and awaken it for 10 minutes. This awakening ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or die.
While your Astral Self is awakened, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Armor of the Spirit
items.entry: You gain a +2 bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

items.name: Astral Barrage
items.entry: When you use the {@classFeature Extra Attack|Monk|XPHB|5} feature to attack twice, you can instead attack three times if all the attacks are made with your Astral Arms.

items.name: Astral Deflection
items.entry: When you use your {@classFeature Deflect Attacks|Monk|XPHB|3} feature, you may add an additional Martial Arts die to the damage dealt.

items.name: Soulsight
items.entry: You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Projection
entries: You can expend 10 Focus Points to cast the {@spell Astral Projection|XPHB} spell. When you cast this spell in this way, you don’t require Material components and you can only affect yourself, unless you expend 2 additional Focus Points for each additional creature you want to affect, up to your Wisdom modifier. Once you cast Astral Projection this way, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Drunken Fist
entries: {@i The Path to Victory is Never Straight}

The Warrior of the Drunken Fist follows an unorthodox fighting style, mimicking the staggered, erratic movements of a drunkard to bewilder opponents. What appears to be a clumsy stumble is, in fact, a precise and elusive combat technique, where blocks, parries, and strikes blend seamlessly into a chaotic, yet calculated, rhythm. These warriors use humor and unpredictability to frustrate enemies, often playing the fool to disarm arrogance or lift spirits. However, in battle, they are far from clumsy, proving to be unpredictable and formidable foes.

subclassFeature.name: Drunken Technique
entries: Your martial arts technique mixes combat training with the precision of a dancer and the antics of a jester.

items.name: Homebrewed
items.entry: You gain a set of {@item Brewer's Supplies|XPHB} and you have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with it. You also have Proficiency with the {@skill Performance|XPHB} skill.

items.name: Twist and Turn
items.entry: Whenever you use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|XPHB|2}, you gain the benefit of the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, and your Speed increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Tipsy Sway
entries: You can move in sudden, swaying ways. You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Leap to Your Feet
items.entry: When you have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, you can stand up by spending 5 feet of movement, rather than half your Speed.

items.name: Redirect Attack
items.entry: You can add your Wisdom modifier to the damage reduced by {@classFeature Deflect Attacks|Monk|XPHB|3}. In addition, when a creature misses you with the attack, you can expend  1 Focus Point to use your Deflect Attacks feature to redirect it.

subclassFeature.name: Drunken Grace
entries: Your unpredictable movements and iron constitution make you seem untouchable, shrugging off toxins and turning fortune in your favor.

items.name: Poison Resilience
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Drunkard's Luck
items.entry: When you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can expend 2 Focus Points to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on it.

subclassFeature.name: Intoxicated Frenzy
entries: Your chaotic fighting style lets you overwhelm multiple foes or relentlessly batter a single opponent with a flurry of strikes.

items.name: Cluster Frenzy
items.entry: When you use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|XPHB|2}, you can make up to three additional attacks, provided that no more than one attack targets the same enemy.

items.name: Singular Frenzy
items.entry: When you use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|XPHB|2}, you can make one additional attack, but only if all your Flurry of Blows attacks target the same creature.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Kensei
entries: {@i The Blade’s Precision Reveals the Soul’s Intent}

Warriors of the Kensei, otherwise known as Sword Saints, dedicate themselves to mastering their chosen weapons until these tools become extensions of their very being. Rooted in the art of swordsmanship, this tradition has grown to encompass a wide variety of weapons. A Kensei warrior approaches his weapon as an artist would a paintbrush or a pen, using it to channel the elegance and precision of his martial prowess. His exceptional skill is the result of unwavering dedication, rigorous practice, and deep study.

subclassFeature.name: Kensei Warrior's Training
entries: Your special martial arts training leads you to master the use of certain weapons. This path also includes instruction in the deft strokes of calligraphy or painting. You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Kensei Weapons
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in {@item Longbow|XPHB|Longbows} and all martial weapons that lacks the Heavy property. Those weapons are Monk weapons for you.

items.name: Weapon Mastery
items.entry: Your training with weapons allows you to use the {@variantrule Weapon Mastery Properties|XPHB|Mastery properties} of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB}. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose.

items.name: Way of the Brush
items.entry: You gain a set of {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB} or a set of {@item Painter's Supplies|XPHB}. You also gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} with the chosen Artisan Tool.

subclassFeature.name: Kensei Weapon's Soul
entries: Your training in monk weapons allows you to use them as an extension of your soul.

items.name: Kensei Strikes
items.entry: When you take the {@action Attack} action, and have not made any {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} that turn, you can decide to replace all Unarmed Strikes you make that turn with melee attacks using a Monk weapon. The damage roll for these attacks uses your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} die.

items.name: Agile Parry
items.entry: If you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} as part of the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn and are holding a Monk weapon, you can use it to defend yourself if it is a melee weapon. You gain a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, while the weapon is in your hand, and you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Kensei's Shot
items.entry: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to make your ranged attacks with a ranged weapon more deadly. When you do so, any target you hit with a ranged attack using a Monk weapon takes an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapon's type. You retain this benefit until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Blade
entries: You extend your focus into your monk weapons, granting you the following benefits.

items.name: Magic Kensei Weapons
items.entry: When you attack with a Monk weapon, you can choose to deal the weapon’s damage type or Force damage.

items.name: Deft Strike
items.entry: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a Monk weapon, you can expend 1 Focus Point to deal additional damage equal to a roll of your {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk|XPHB|1} die.

subclassFeature.name: Sharpen the Blade
entries: You gain the ability to augment your weapons further with your focus. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend up to 3 Focus Points to grant a Monk weapon you touch a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to the number of Focus Points you spent. This bonus lasts for 10 minutes or until you use this feature again.

If you want to use this effect on a magic weapon, you need to spend twice the number of Focus Points. If the weapon already has a bonus to attack and damage rolls, the attack and damage bonus of the weapon when you apply this effect cannot be higher than 4.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Sage
entries: Your mastery of weapons brings out the potential of your Kensei weapons. You gain the following benefits with each weapon mastery property:

items.name: Nick
items.entry: The extra attack you make as part of the Light property can add your ability modifier to the damage roll.

items.name: Push
items.entry: You can use this Mastery property on Huge creatures or smaller.

items.name: Sap
items.entry: The target can’t make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against you until the end of the current turn.

items.name: Slow
items.entry: The target’s Speed is reduced by 15 feet instead of 10.

items.name: Topple
items.entry: On a failed saving throw, the target takes Bludgeoning damage equal to the ability modifier you used for the attack.

items.name: Vex
items.entry: If you miss with an attack using this weapon, you can reroll and add your Wisdom modifier to the result. You can gain this benefit only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Long Death
entries: {@i Death is a Teacher, Heed its Lessons Closely}

Warriors of the Long Death are obsessed with the meaning and mechanics of dying. They capture creatures and prepare elaborate experiments to capture, record, and understand the moments of their demise. They use this knowledge to guide their understanding of martial arts, yielding a deadly fighting style.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of Death
entries: Your study of death allows you to extract vitality from another creature as it nears its demise. When you reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Wisdom modifier plus your Monk level (minimum of 1 Temporary Hit Point). You also gain this benefit if someone else reduces an enemy within 10 feet of you to 0 Hit Points.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Reaper’s Touch
entries: Whenever you deal damage with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Necrotic damage or its normal damage type. When you deal Necrotic damage to a creature in this way, that creature can’t regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Hour of Reaping
entries: You gain the ability to unsettle or terrify those around you as your soul has been touched by the shadow of death. As an Action you can force each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that can see you to succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Mastery of Death
entries: Your close bond and familiarity with death give you the following benefits:

items.name: Death’s Warm Embrace
items.entry: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can expend 1 Focus Point (no action required) to have 1 Hit Point instead.

items.name: Befriending Death
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of the Long Death
entries: Your touch can channel the energy of death into a creature. As a Magic action, you touch one creature within 5 feet of you, and you expend 1 to 10 Focus Points. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, and it takes {@damage 2d12} Necrotic damage per Focus Point spent on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that dies by this damage cannot be revived by any means other than the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Sun Soul
entries: {@i Unleash the Sun’s Energy with Every Strike}

Warriors of the Sun Soul harness their inner energy to manifest intense bursts of radiant light. They teach that meditation can unlock the ability to unleash the indomitable light shed by the soul of every living creature. This tradition emphasizes the purity and strength that can be drawn from the light within, transforming the monk into a beacon of celestial energy.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Sun Soul
entries: Your solar soul emanates from you in the following ways.

items.name: Radiant Sun Bolt
items.entry: Your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} can be augmented to be a ranged attack with a range of 30 feet. When you do, its damage type changes to Radiant and can’t utilize the Grapple or Shove options.

items.name: Radiant Sun Light
items.entry: You know the {@spell Light|XPHB} cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Searing Arc Strike
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend up to 3 Focus Points to cause a 15-foot Cone of fire to come out of your hands. Roll a number of Martial Arts dice equal to 1 plus the amount of Focus Points expended. Each creature inside the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking Fire damage equal to the total rolled on a failed save and half on a success. Any objects not being worn or carried start burning.
You can expend additional Focus Points as you gain Monk levels. You can expend 4 Focus Points at level 5, 5 at level 9, and 6 at level 17.

subclassFeature.name: Searing Sunburst
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you magically create an orb and hurl it, where it erupts in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within 150 feet of yourself.
Each creature in the Sphere must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage. A creature doesn’t need to make the save if the creature is behind Total Cover.
You can increase the sphere’s damage by expending Focus Points points. Each point you expend, to a maximum of 3, increases the damage by {@damage 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Sun Shield
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while in bright light, you can expend 3 Focus Points to illuminate yourself for 1 minute, until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or until you end your turn in Darkness. While illuminated you gain the following benefits.

items.name: Rising Sol
items.entry: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed and can hover.

items.name: Melting Aura
items.entry: When you are hit by a melee attack, the attacker takes 10 Radiant damage. You can also deal this damage to the target of your {@classFeature Deflect Attacks|Monk|XPHB|3}.

items.name: Reaching Rays
items.entry: The range of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} augmented by {@subclassFeature Radiant Sun Bolt|Monk|XPHB|Sun Soul|RTReestablished|3} increases to 60 feet. In addition, the range of your {@subclassFeature Searing Sunburst|Monk|XPHB|Sun Soul|RTReestablished|11} increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Conquest
entries: {@i Impose Your Might and Subdue All Opposition}

The Oath of Conquest calls to paladins who seek to dominate their enemies and enforce absolute order. These paladins, known as Iron Warlords or Tyrants, believe that true peace comes through unwavering strength and control. Some embrace darkness, valuing law over mercy and wearing trophies of fallen foes to intimidate any who challenge them. Such knights are referred to by some as hell knights. The other Paladins of this oath fiercy resist hell knights, believing they have wandered too far into darkness.
