These paladins adhere to the following tenets:

items: Crush all resistance.
Rule with unyielding authority.
Pursue strength relentlessly.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Conquest Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Conquest Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Conquering Presence
entries: You can channel your divine power to issue an imperious mandate. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to cast the {@spell Command|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast it in this way, the effective level of the spell is equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Guided Strike
entries: Your oath lets you strike with supernatural accuracy. When you miss an attack roll, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Conquest
entries: Your commanding presence imposes relentless pressure on your foes. If you choose to, creatures within your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6} take Psychic damage equal to your Paladin level when they fail their saving throw against your {@spell Command|XPHB} spell, and half as much damage if they succeed.

subclassFeature.name: Scornful Rebuke
entries: Those who dare to strike you are psychically punished for their audacity. Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, that creature takes Psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) if you do not have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Invincible Conqueror
entries: You gain the ability to harness extraordinary martial prowess. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

items.name: Damage Resistance
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage.

items.name: Extra Attack
items.entry: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as part of that action.

items.name: Brutal Attacks
items.entry: Your melee weapon attacks score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Crown
entries: {@i Embody the Ideals of Duty and Service}

The Oath of the Crown is sworn by paladins who dedicate themselves to the principles of civilization, whether through loyalty to a nation, fealty to a sovereign, or service to a deity of law and order. These paladins see themselves as guardians of society, protecting it from the chaos that seeks to undermine its foundations. Known as Guardians, Exemplars, or Sentinels, they often serve in knightly orders, taking their oath as part of their commitment to uphold the stability and laws that sustain their communities.
These paladins adhere to the following tenets:

items: Enforce the laws of society.
Support allies in any circumstance.
Fulfill duty and obligation.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Crown Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of the Crown Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Champion Challenge
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to issue a challenge that compels other creatures to do battle with you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't willingly move more than 30 feet away from you and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against creatures other than you. This effect lasts for 1 minute.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect also ends early on a creature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, die, or if the creature is more than 30 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Turn the Tide
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to bolster injured creatures. Each {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature of your choice that can hear you within 30 feet of you regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Allegiance
entries: Your presence deters enemies from targeting your allies. While an ally is within your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to grant it the benefits of the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action whilest it remains in your Aura of Protection this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Spirit
entries: You become a relentless force in your cause. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws and ability checks to avoid or end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Exalted Champion
entries: Your presence on the field of battle is an inspiration to those dedicated to your cause. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

items.name: Damage Resistance
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing damage.

items.name: Death Saving Throws
items.entry: Your allies have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} while in your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6}.

items.name: Wisdom Saving Throws
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom saving throws, as do your allies in your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Redemption
entries: {@i Lead Others Back to the Path of Righteousness}

The Oath of Redemption calls paladins to a path of peace and transformation, believing that all creatures can be redeemed, no matter how far they’ve strayed. Redeemers confront evil with compassion, seeking to turn enemies into allies and using violence only as a last resort. They strive to be a beacon of hope, but remain pragmatic, understanding that some beings, like undead and demons, are beyond redemption and must be confronted with force to protect the greater good.
These paladins adhere to the following tenets:

items: Nurture innocence and peace.
Find potential for righteousness.
Practice patience and clarity.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Redemption Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Redemption Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of Peace
entries: You can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to augment your presence with divine power. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you grant yourself a +5 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for the next 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Rebuke the Violent
entries: Immediately after an attacker within 30 feet of you deals damage with an attack against a creature other than you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you rebuke the attacker, who takes Radiant damage equal to the damage it just dealt. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Guardian
entries: You can shield others from harm at the cost of your own health. When a creature within your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6} takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to magically take that damage, instead of that creature taking it. This feature doesn't transfer any other effects that might accompany the damage, and this damage can't be reduced in any way but the {@subclassFeature Emissary of Redemption|Paladin|XPHB|Redemption|RTReestablished|20} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Spirit
entries: A holy presence mends your wounds in battle. If you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} at the end of your turn, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your Paladin level (rounded up). You can’t use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of Redemption
entries: You can assume the form of an avatar of Peace. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

items.name: Radiant Rebuke
items.entry: Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, it takes Radiant damage equal to half the damage it dealt to you.

items.name: Stout Guardian
items.entry: When you use your {@subclassFeature Aura of the Guardian|Paladin|XPHB|Redemption|RTReestablished|7} feature, you now reduce the damage you take by half.

items.name: Sacred Sanctuary
items.entry: You can cast the {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Watchers
entries: {@i Stand Against Dread from Beyond the Stars}

The Oath of the Watchers binds paladins to protect the mortal realms from extraplanar threats, which are beyond the reach of ordinary soldiers. These paladins undergo relentless training to hone their minds, spirits, and bodies, striving to be the ultimate defenders against such formidable dangers. They remain ever-watchful for signs of otherworldly influence and often establish networks of spies and informants to monitor potential cults and infernal infiltrations. For Watchers, vigilance and readiness are as crucial as their armor, as they cultivate a culture of suspicion and preparedness to safeguard against these potent threats.
These paladins adhere to the following tenets:

items: Monitor extraplanar activity.
Reject supernatural aid.
Prepare your mind and body for any challenge..

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Watchers Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of the Watchers Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Cognizance
entries: Your divine connection sharpens your intellect, granting you heightened clarity. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to gain a bonus to your Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB} or {@skill Religion|XPHB}) checks. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) and last for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Watcher’s Will
entries: You invest your presence with the warding power of your faith. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to choose a number of creatures you can see within 30 feet of you, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). For 1 minute, you and the chosen creatures have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Sentinel
entries: When you or a creature of your choice within your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6} rolls for {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, it adds your Charisma modifier (minimum +1) to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Rebuke
entries: You’ve learned how to chastise anyone who dares wield beguilements against you and your wards. Whenever you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you succeeds on an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal {@damage 2d8} + your Charisma modifier Force damage to the creature that forced the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Mortal Bulwark
entries: You manifest a spark of divine power in defense of the mortal realms. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

items.name: Truesight
items.entry: You gain {@sense Truesight|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

items.name: Eldritch Warder
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against {@filter Aberrations|bestiary|type=abberation}, {@filter Celestials|bestiary|type=celestial}, {@filter Elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter Fey|bestiary|type=fey}, and {@filter Fiends|f|type=fiend}.

items.name: Cosmic Exile
items.entry: When you hit a creature with an attack roll and deal damage to it, you can also force it to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is magically banished to its native plane of existence if it’s currently not there. On a successful save, the creature can’t be banished by this feature for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Oathbreaker
entries: {@i Wield the Corruption Born from Broken Promises}

Once a beacon of virtue, the Oathbreaker is a fallen paladin who has abandoned their sacred vows for dark ambitions or to serve malevolent powers. Their inner light has been extinguished, leaving only the shadow of their former self. This transformation involves a complete renunciation of their holy oath, replaced by a drive to wield dark powers and command sinister forces.

An Oathbreaker embraces corruption, channeling their abilities to spread fear and chaos. They forsake their previous oath’s tenets for new powers aligned with darkness and domination. As they delve deeper into their new path, they gain control over the undead, wield dark spells, and radiate an aura of dread.
These paladins adhere to the following tenets:

subclassFeature.name: Oathbreaker Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oathbreaker Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Profane Weapon
entries: You can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3} to cast the {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot. When you cast it in this way, the effective level of the spell is equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Hate
entries: Your blows are charged with a tireless hatred for those lacking the courage to take their own path. When you hit a {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature in your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6} with an attack roll using a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, the target takes extra damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Dreadbane Defense
entries: Your reluctance towards holy vows has fortified your mind against outside influence. You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Psychic damage and the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Dread Lord
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can imbue your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6} with false promises and dark intentions, granting the following benefits for 1 minute or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore its use by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

items.name: Horror Ward
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any saving throw you are forced to make by a {@filter Celestial|bestiary|type=celestial} or an {@filter Undead|bestiary|type=undead}.

items.name: Necrotic Damage
items.entry: Whenever an enemy starts its turn within the aura, it takes Necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier plus your Proficiency Bonus.

items.name: Darkness
items.entry: The aura is filled with magical {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}. You and a number of creatures up to your Charisma modifier (chosen when you activate this feature) can see normally in this Darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Drakewarden
entries: {@i Form an Unbreakable Bond with a Draconic Spirit}

As a Drakewarden, you form a mystical bond with a draconic spirit that grants you a powerful companion—a drake. This loyal creature starts small but grows alongside you, ultimately becoming a majestic ally capable of flight and battle. Your connection to draconic lore enhances your abilities, often forged through ancient rituals or rare artifacts. As your drake matures, your mastery of dragon magic increases, making you a formidable presence in both wilderness and combat.

entries.caption: Drakewarden Origin
rows: You studied a dragon’s scale or claw, or a trinket from a dragon’s hoard, creating your bond through that token’s lingering draconic magic.
A secret order of rangers who collect and guard draconic lore taught you their ways.
A dragon gave you a geode or gemstone to care for. To your surprise, the drake hatched from that stone.
You ingested a few drops of dragon blood, forever infusing your nature magic with draconic power.
An ancient Draconic inscription on a standing stone empowered you when you read it aloud.
You had a vivid dream of a mysterious figure accompanied by seven yellow canaries, who warned you of impending doom. When you awoke, your drake was there, watching you.

subclassFeature.name: Drake Companion
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action, you magically summon a drake, bound to you through ancient draconic magic. It appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of you.

The drake uses the {@creature Drake Companion|RTReestablished} stat block. Whenever you summon the drake, choose a damage type listed in its Draconic Essence trait. You determine the drake’s appearance, such as its color, scale texture, or other visual effects of its essence; your choice has no effect on its game statistics.

In combat, the Drake shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action, unless you take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, the Drake can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

The Drake remains until it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, until you use this feature to summon the Drake again, or until you die. Anything the drake was wearing or carrying is left behind when the drake vanishes.
Once you summon the Drake, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a spell slot to summon it.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Gift
entries: The bond you share with your drake creates a connection to dragonkind, granting you understanding and empowering your presence. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Thaumaturgy
items.entry: You learn the {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB} cantrip.

items.name: Tongue of Dragons
items.entry: You learn to speak, read, and write {@language Draconic|XPHB} or one other language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of Fang and Scale
entries: The bond you share with your drake intensifies, protecting you and stoking the drake's fury. When you summon your drake, it grows wings on its back and gains a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to its Speed.
In addition, while your drake is summoned, you and the drake gain the following benefits:

items.name: Drake Mount
items.entry: The drake grows to Medium size. Reflecting your special bond, you can use the drake as a mount if your size is Medium or smaller. While you are riding your drake, it can't use the Fly Speed of this feature.

items.name: Magic Fang
items.entry: The drake's Bite attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the type chosen for the drake's Draconic Essence.

items.name: Resistance
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to the damage type chosen for the drake's Draconic Essence.

subclassFeature.name: Drake's Breath
entries: As an Action, you can exhale a 30-foot cone of damaging breath or cause your drake to exhale it. Choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage (your choice doesn't have to match your drake's Draconic Essence). Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 8d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This damage increases to {@damage 10d6} when you reach 15th level in this class.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Bond
entries: Your bond to your drake reaches the pinnacle of its power. While your drake is summoned, you and the drake gain the following benefits:

items.name: Empowered Bite
items.entry: The drake's Bite attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the type chosen for its Draconic Essence (for a total of {@damage 2d6} extra damage).

items.name: Large Drake
items.entry: The drake grows to Large size. When you ride your drake, it is no longer prohibited from using the {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of {@subclassFeature Bond of Fang and Scale|Ranger|XPHB|Drakewarden|RTReestablished|7}.

items.name: Reflexive Resistance
items.entry: When either you or the Drake takes damage while you’re within 30 feet of each other, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give yourself or the Drake {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that instance of damage, and to all damage of the same type(s) until the start of your next turn. You can use this Reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Horizon Walker
entries: {@i Stand as the Defender Between Worlds}

Horizon Walkers are rangers who guard the boundaries between planes, protecting the mortal world from interdimensional threats. Drawn to hidden portals, they venture into strange realms to face enemies wielding otherworldly magic. Their expertise in planar travel and their alliances with powerful beings like dragons, fey, and elemental forces help them maintain the order of the multiverse. Equipped with magic that lets them cross between worlds, Horizon Walkers defend against disruptions that threaten the natural order.

subclassFeature.name: Horizon Walker Magic
entries: Your travels through the multiverse ensure you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Ranger level specified in the Horizon Walker Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Detect Outer Anomaly
entries: You gain the ability to magically perceive the presence of interplanar threats. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can open your senses in one of the following ways (your choice when taking this action):

items.name: Detect Planar Invader
items.entry: You cast the {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB} spell.

items.name: Detect Planar Portal
items.entry: You detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal within 1 mile of you.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Warrior
entries: You learn to harness the energy of the multiverse to enhance your attacks. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can convert all damage from the attack into Force damage, and the creature takes an additional {@damage 1d6} Force damage.
The extra damage increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach level 11 in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Step
entries: You learn to step through the Ethereal Plane. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast the {@spell Etherealness|XPHB} spell with this feature, without expending a spell slot, but the spell ends at the end of the current turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Distant Strike
entries: You gain the ability to pass between the planes in the blink of an eye. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack to an unoccupied space you can see.
If you attack at least two different creatures with the action, you can make one additional attack with it against a third creature.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Defense
entries: Your ability to move between planes enables you to slip through the planar boundaries to lessen the harm done to you during battle. When you take damage from an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give yourself Resistance to all of that attack's damage. Until the start of your next turn, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to one damage type dealt by the triggering attack.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Slayer
entries: {@i Strike Fear into the Hearts of Malevolent Horrors}

As a Monster Slayer, you dedicate your life to tracking and defeating the horrors that hide in the shadows, such as vampires, dragons, fiends, and malevolent fey. Equipped with supernatural techniques and a deep knowledge of your enemies, you excel at uncovering and overcoming even the strongest foes. More than mere warriors, Monster Slayers are experts in the lore of dark creatures, using their insights to exploit weaknesses and develop effective strategies in battle. With each hunt, you grow increasingly formidable, combining skill and cunning to keep the forces of darkness at bay.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Slayer Magic
entries: Your training to hunt monsters ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Ranger level specified in the Monster Slayer Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer's Prey
entries: You can focus your ire on one foe, increasing the harm you inflict on it. The first time each turn that you hit a creature affected by your {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} spell with an attack, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic or Radiant damage (your choice when you deal the damage).

subclassFeature.name: Slayer's Sense
entries: Your keen senses give you a supernatural knowing. As a result, whenever you make an Intelligence check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
In addition, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Religion|XPHB}, or {@skill Nature|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Supernatural Defense
entries: You gain extra resilience against the assaults of your prey on your mind and body.

items.name: Escaping Horrors
items.entry: Whenever a creature marked by your {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} forces you to make a saving throw, or when you make an ability check to escape that creature's grapple, you can add your Hunter’s Mark die to your roll.

items.name: Free Casting
items.entry: You can cast the {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB} spell without expending a spell slot, Material components, or requiring concentration. The spell lasts for one minute when cast this way. You can't cast this spell in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Magic-User's Nemesis
entries: You gain the ability to thwart someone else's magic. When you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell or teleporting, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to try to magically foil it. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, or its spell or teleport fails and is wasted.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer's Counter
entries: You gain the ability to counterattack when your prey tries to sabotage you. If the target of your {@spell Hunter's Mark|XPHB} forces you to make a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make one weapon attack against the quarry. You make this attack immediately before making the saving throw. If your attack hits, your save automatically succeeds, in addition to the attack's normal effects.

subclassFeature.name: Swarmkeeper
entries: {@i Dance Among Spirits and Create Unity}

As a Swarmkeeper, you share a deep bond with a swarm of nature spirits, using their power to enhance your abilities in battle and strengthen your connection to the environment. This magical swarm acts as both a formidable ally and a loyal companion. Some Swarmkeepers prefer solitude with their ethereal allies, while others thrive in communities that benefit from their bonds. Your connection to the swarm allows you to channel its energy for protection and battlefield control. Whether in isolation or among a vibrant community, your bond with nature grants you unique powers, making you a formidable guardian of the wild.

subclassFeature.name: Swarmkeeper Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} cantrip. When you cast it, the hand takes the form of your swarming nature spirits. It counts as a Ranger cantrip for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

Also, your connection to your Swarm ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Ranger level specified in the Swarmkeeper Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Gathered Swarm
entries: A swarm of intangible nature spirits has bonded itself to you and can assist you in battle. While you're alive, the swarm remains in your space, crawling on you or flying and skittering around you within your space. You determine its appearance (swarming insects, miniature twig blights, fluttering birds, playful pixies, etc).
Once on each of your turns, you can cause the swarm to assist you in one of the following ways, immediately after you hit a creature with an attack:

items.name: Damage
items.entry: The attack's target takes {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage from the swarm.

items.name: Forced Movement
items.entry: The attack's target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be moved by the swarm up to 15 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.

items.name: Carrying Swarm
items.entry: You are moved by the swarm 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Writhing Tide
entries: You can condense part of your swarm into a focused mass that lifts you up. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 10 feet and can {@variantrule Hover|XPHB}. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Swarm
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Gathered Swarm|Ranger|XPHB|Swarmkeeper|RTReestablished|3} grows mightier in the following ways:

items.name: Damage
items.entry: The damage of Gathered Swarm increases to {@damage 1d8}.

items.name: Forced Movement
items.entry: If a creature fails its saving throw against being moved by Gathered Swarm, you can also cause the creature to have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Carrying Swarm.
items.entry: When you are moved by Gathered Swarm, it gives you {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Half Cover} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Swarming Dispersal
entries: You can discorporate into your swarm, avoiding danger. When you take damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give yourself {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type until the end of that turn. You vanish into your swarm and then teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you, where you reappear with the swarm.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Inquisitive
entries: {@i Pierce Through Deception with Sharp Insight}

An Inquisitive’s mastery lies in uncovering hidden truths and deciphering mysteries with a razor-sharp eye for detail. Combining astute observation with a deep understanding of motives, these Rogues excel at exposing creatures that lurk in the shadows and prey on the unsuspecting. With their profound knowledge and investigative skills, Inquisitives are adept at bringing hidden threats to light and confronting the dark forces that seek to undermine the common folk.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Inquisition
entries: Your sharp instincts and practiced skills help you uncover hidden details and track down elusive clues.

items.name: Ear for Deceit
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} and {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the {@skill Insight|XPHB} skill. If you have Expertise in Insight already, you instead gain Expertise in {@skill Investigation|XPHB} or {@skill Perception|XPHB}. Likewise if you have Proficiency in Insight already, you gain Proficiency in one of those two skills.

items.name: Eye for Detail
items.entry: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can take the {@action Search|XPHB} action, or the {@action Study|XPHB} action.

subclassFeature.name: Insightful Fighting
entries: You learn how to read your opponents and improve your attacks. When you miss with an attack roll, you can add a bonus to the roll (no action required), potentially causing the attack to hit. The bonus is equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Steady Eye
entries: Your ability to understand your enemies allows you to predict posible actions against you. You gain the following {@classFeature Cunning Strike|Rogue|XPHB|5} options.

items.name: Discerning Senses (Cost: 1d6).
items.entry: You can take the {@action Search|XPHB} action as part of this attack.

items.name: Piercing Knowledge (Cost: 1d6).
items.entry: You can take the {@action Study|XPHB} action as part of this attack.

subclassFeature.name: Unerring Eye
entries: Your senses pierce through deception. You have {@sense Truesight|XPHB} within a range of 5 feet, provided you don’t have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} or {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can extend your Truesight to a range of 30 feet until the end of your next turn. You can extend your Truesight this way a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Eye for Weakness
entries: You learn to exploit a creature's weaknesses by carefully studying its tactics and movement. When you hit a creature with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1} damage against that creature increases by {@damage 3d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Mastermind
entries: {@i Wield Influence and Secrets with Strategic Precision}

A Mastermind excels in the art of manipulation and intrigue, using their understanding of people and their motivations to shape events from the shadows. Whether operating as a cunning spy, a calculating courtier, or a devious schemer, a Mastermind’s true power lies in their ability to turn words into weapons and secrets into valuable assets. Masterminds thrive on their knack for negotiation, covert operations, and leveraging information to outmaneuver opponents and achieve their objectives.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Intrigue
entries: Your refined cunning and practiced manipulations enable you to deceive, influence, and blend into any crowd.

items.name: Tongue for Deceit
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} and {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the {@skill Deception|XPHB} skill. If you have Expertise in Deception already, you instead gain Expertise in {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}. Likewise, if you have Proficiency in Deception already, you gain Proficiency in one of those two skills. In addition, you learn two languages of your choice.

items.name: Mastermind’s Tools
items.entry: You gain a {@item Disguise Kit|XPHB}, a {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB} and one {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} of your choice. You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in each of them.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Tactics
entries: Your mastery on the battlefield allows you to direct your allies with unmatched precision.

items.name: Cunning Assistance
items.entry: You can use the {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Masterful Direction
items.entry: When you use the {@action Help|XPHB} action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than within 5 feet of you, provided the target and the ally can both see or hear you.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Deceit
entries: Your keen understanding of social dynamics allows you to resist manipulation and subtly influence those around you.

items.name: Discerning Mind
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Keeness of Tongue
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|XPHB} or {@skill Deception|XPHB}) checks to influence a nonhostile creature.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Misdirection
entries: You gain the following Cunning Strike option:

items.name: Reflex Strike (Cost: 5d6).
items.entry: The target makes an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target must take a Reaction to make an attack roll against a creature of your choice within its reach if it’s a melee attack or range if it’s a ranged attack. (If it has access to both, you may decide which it takes).

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Deceit
entries: Your mind is an impenetrable fortress, you gain the following benefits.

items.name: Psychic Resistance
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

items.name: Sealed Thoughts
items.entry: Your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means, unless you allow it. You can present false thoughts by succeeding on a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check contested by the mind reader's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. In addition, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

items.name: Accomplished Liar
items.entry: No matter what you say, magic that would determine if you are telling the truth indicates you are being truthful if you so choose, and you can't be compelled to tell the truth by magic.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom
entries: {@i Harness Death's Power to Walk the Shadowed Line}

The Phantom Rogue specializes in harnessing the power of death and straddling the line between life and the afterlife. Drawing strength from the dead, they become conduits of the departed’s knowledge and wielders of negative energy, eventually becoming like ghosts. Phantoms often serve as spies or gatherers of secret information otherwise lost to the grave. They are typically trained in death-focused places like Shadar-kai enclaves or necromancer strongholds, or they work as agents of death gods, enforcing the inevitability of death upon those who would cheat it.

subclassFeature.name: Whispers of the Dead
entries: Echoes of those who have died cling to you. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can choose one {@table Skill List; Skills|XPHB|skill} or {@filter tool proficiency|items|type=tool;artisan's tools} that you lack and gain it, as a ghostly presence shares its knowledge with you. You lose this {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} when you use this feature to choose a different Proficiency that you lack.

subclassFeature.name: Tokens of the Departed
entries: When a life ends in your presence, you're able to snatch a token from the departing soul, a sliver of its life essence that takes physical form: as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when a creature you can see dies within 30 feet of you, you can open your free hand and cause a Tiny trinket to appear there, a Soul Trinket. The DM determines the trinket's form or has you roll on the {@item Trinket|XPHB|Trinkets} table in the {@book Player's Handbook|XPHB} to generate it.

These Soul Trinkets fuel certain powers you have from this subclass. When a Soul Trinket is expended, it is also destroyed and you can’t make a trinket from that creature again. Likewise, when you regain expended uses, a new Soul Trinket is made. The Soul Trinket table shows the number of Soul Trinkets you have when you reach certain Rogue levels.

You can’t use an ability that requires a Soul Trinket if all your trinkets have been expended. You regain half (rounded up) of your expended Soul Trinkets when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, as the spirits of the dead are drawn to you.

subclassFeature.name: Wails from the Grave
entries: As you nudge someone closer to the grave, you can channel the power of death to harm someone else as well. Immediately after you deal your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1} damage to a creature on your turn, you can expend a Soul Trinket to target a second creature that you can see within 30 feet of the first creature. Roll half the number of Sneak Attack dice for your level (round up), and the second creature takes Necrotic damage equal to the roll's total, as wails of the dead sound around them for a moment.

subclassFeature.name: Whispers of the Departed
entries: You now regain one expended Soul Token when you finish a Short Rest. In addition, You gain additional uses for your Soul Trinkets:

items.name: Phantom Vitality
items.entry: While a Soul Trinket is on your person, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws} and Constitution saving throws, for your vitality is enhanced by the life essence within the object.

items.name: Speak with Phantoms
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a Soul Trinket, no matter where it’s located, to cast the {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} spell without a spell slot or components, targeting the trinket and speaking with its associated creature, instead of a corpse.

subclassFeature.name: Ghost Walk
entries: You can phase partially into the realm of the dead, becoming like a ghost. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you assume a spectral form. While in this form, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 10 feet, you can {@variantrule Hover|XPHB}, and attack rolls have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you. You can also move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, but you take {@damage 1d10} Force damage if you end your turn inside a creature or an object.

You stay in this form for 10 minutes or until you end it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend a Soul Trinket (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Death's Friend
entries: Your association with death has become so close that you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Resonant Wail
items.entry: When you use your {@subclassFeature Wails from the Grave|Rogue|XPHB|Phantom|RTReestablished|3}, you can deal the Necrotic damage to both the first and the second creature.

items.name: Phantom Call
items.entry: At the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you regain all expended Soul Trinkets.

subclassFeature.name: Scout
entries: {@i Master the Wilderness as a Swift and Silent Hunter}

Scouts are Rogues who thrive far beyond the city’s walls, moving through the wilderness with unmatched agility and stealth. Whether tracking prey, scouting for danger, or ambushing foes, Scouts rely on sharp survival instincts. Often the first to detect threats and strike, they are invaluable as spies, ambushers, and bounty hunters. Their abilities resemble those of Rangers and Barbarians, thriving in natural settings and serving as the eyes and ears of expeditions. Scouts are known for their adaptability, moving unseen through forests, plains, and other wild terrains with precision and speed.

subclassFeature.name: Skirmisher
entries: You are difficult to pin down during a fight. When a creature moves into a space within 5 feet of you or ends its turn there, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half your Speed. This movement doesn’t provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.
Starting at level 5, you can move in this way when you use {@classFeature Uncanny Dodge|Rogue|XPHB|5}, as part of the same Reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Survivalist
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} and {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the {@skill Nature|XPHB} and {@skill Survival|XPHB} skills. If you already have Expertise with either skill, you instead gain Expertise with a different skill with which you have Proficiency in its place. Likewise, if you have Proficiency in either skill already, you gain Proficiency with a different skill from the Rogue skill list.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Mobility
entries: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. In addition, you gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} and {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Ambush Master
entries: You excel at leading ambushes, granting you {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls. In addition, you learn the following Cunning Strike option.

items.name: Ambush Strike (Cost:2d6).
items.entry: Attack rolls against the target have Advantage until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sudden Strike
entries: You can strike with deadly speed. If you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. This attack can benefit from your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1} even if you have already used it this turn, but you can’t use your Sneak Attack against the same target more than once in a turn.

subclassFeature.name: Swashbuckler
entries: {@i Fight with Poise and Speed, Dancing Around Danger}

Swashbucklers are Rogues who blend speed, finesse, and charm to turn combat into a graceful performance. Masters of one-on-one dueling, they dart in and out of danger with unmatched agility, relying on wit and dexterity to outmaneuver opponents. Swashbucklers thrive in duels, pirate skirmishes, and any situation requiring quick thinking and swift strikes. Their flashy, daring combat style sets them apart, making them vexxing for warriors who rely on brute strength alone.

subclassFeature.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: You’ve learned how to land a strike and then slip away without reprisal. If you make a melee attack against a creature during your turn, that creature can’t make {@variantrule Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against you for the rest of that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rakish Audacity
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can give yourself a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier.

You also gain an additional way to use your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1}; you don’t need {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack roll to use your Sneak Attack against a creature if you are within 5 feet of it, no other creatures are within 5 feet of you, and you don’t have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the attack roll. All the other rules for Sneak Attack still apply to you.

subclassFeature.name: Panache
entries: You have practiced new ways to use your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1}. The following effects are now among your {@classFeature Cunning Strike|Rogue|XPHB|5} options.

items.name: Goad (Cost: 1d6)
items.entry: The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or until the end of its next turn, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against targets other than you and can’t make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} against targets other than you.

items.name: Awe (Cost: 3d6)
items.entry: Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Dashing Strikes
entries: You have practiced new ways to use your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1}. The following effects are now among your {@classFeature Cunning Strike|Rogue|XPHB|5} options.

items.name: Parrying Stance (Cost: 2d6)
items.entry: Roll a {@dice d6}. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to the number rolled.

items.name: Invigorate (Cost: 2d6)
items.entry: Choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Until the end of that creature’s next turn, whenever it makes an attack roll or a saving throw, it can roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Master Duelist
entries: Immediately after you use your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|XPHB|1}, you can make another attack against the same target, provided you are within 5 feet of it and no other creatures are within 5 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Soul Sorcery
entries: {@i Embody the Magic of the Heavens}

Your magic is a gift from the divine, a spark of celestial power within your soul. It may come from an ancestor who served the gods, a prophecy that marked you as a chosen vessel, or perhaps your ancestor was an angel turned mortal. This divine connection makes you a figure of reverence or fear, a living symbol of divine favor that can challenge existing religious orders. In some cultures, only those with a Divine Soul are seen as true leaders of faith, passing this sacred magic down through their bloodlines.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Magic
entries: Your link to the Divine allows you to learn spells from the Cleric class. When your {@classFeature Spellcasting|Sorcerer|XPHB|1} feature lets you learn or replace a Sorcerer cantrip or prepare a Sorcerer spell of level 1+, you can choose the new spell to be from the {@filter Cleric spell list or the Sorcerer spell list|spells|class=cleric;sorcerer}. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell.

In addition, your connection to a Divine source of magic ensures that you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Divine Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Favored by the Gods
entries: Divine power guards your destiny. If you fail a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You cannot use this feature multiple times on the same roll.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Healing
entries: The divine energy coursing through you can empower healing spells. Whenever you or an ally within 5 feet of you rolls dice to determine the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} a spell restores, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to reroll number of healing dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one), provided you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. You can use this feature only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Wings
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cause spectral wings to appear on your back. The wings last for 1 hour or until you dismiss them (no action required). For the duration, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.
These wings take on an appearance depending on the source of your divine power: eagle wings for good or law-aligned sources, bat wings for evil or chaos, and dragonfly wings for neutrality.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you spend 3 Sorcery Points (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Unearthly Recovery
entries: You gain the ability to overcome grievous injuries. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} when you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}, you can regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Hit Point maximum.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you spend 6 Sorcery Points (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Sorcery
entries: {@i Draw Power from the Moon's Light}

The magic of the moon has infused your lineage, granting you lunar power. Whether your ancestor took part in a druidic ritual during an eclipse or you were touched by a falling shard of moonstone, the moon’s influence overflows in your magic. This connection is evident when you cast your spells; your eyes might glow with moonlight, or phases of the moon could shimmer around you, reflecting your bond with this celestial body.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Embodiment
entries: Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can choose what Lunar Phase manifests its power through your magic: Full Moon, New Moon, or Crescent Moon.

Your connection to your current Lunar Phase ensures you have certain spells ready; when you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Lunar Spells table, you have the spells listed under the Evermoon column always prepared, you thereafter always have the spells listed under the column of your current Lunar Phase prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Moon Fire
entries: You can call down the radiant light of the moon on command.

items.name: Double Flame
items.entry: When you cast the {@spell Sacred Flame|XPHB} cantrip, you can target one creature as normal or target two creatures within range that are within 5 feet of each other.

items.name: Ever Moonbeam
items.entry: You can cast the {@spell Moonbeam|XPHB} spell by spending Sorcery Points equal to the level you want to cast it at, up to a maximum of 1 higher effective level than your highest level spell slot. In addition, when you cast Moonbeam with a spell slot, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to increase its effective level by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Boons
entries: The current phase of your {@subclassFeature Lunar Embodiment|Sorcerer|XPHB|Lunar|RTReestablished|3} can affect your {@classFeature Metamagic|Sorcerer|XPHB|2} feature. Each Lunar Embodiment phase is associated with certain schools of magic, as shown here:

items.name: Full Moon
items.entry: Abjuration and Divination spells.

items.name: New Moon
items.entry: Enchantment and Necromancy spells.

items.name: Crescent Moon
items.entry: Illusion and Transmutation spells.

entries: Whenever you use Metamagic on a spell of a school of magic associated with your current Lunar Embodiment phase, you can reduce the Sorcery Points spent by 1 (minimum 0). You can reduce the Sorcery Points spent for your Metamagic a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Waxing and Waning
entries: You gain greater control over the phases of your lunar magic.

items.name: Blue Moon Shift
items.entry: You can cast {@spell Shield|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB}, and {@spell Color Spray|XPHB} each once without expending a spell slot or having the spell prepared and regain the ability to do so again when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Rapid Phase Shift
items.entry: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change your current Lunar Phase to a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Empowerment
entries: The power of a lunar phase saturates your being. While you are in a {@subclassFeature Lunar Embodiment|Sorcerer|XPHB|Lunar|RTReestablished|3} phase, you also gain the following benefit associated with that phase:

items.name: Full Moon
items.entry: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to shed bright light in a 10 foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} and dim light for an additional 10 feet, or to douse the light. In addition, you and creatures of your choice have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks while within the bright light you shed.

items.name: New Moon
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks. In addition, while you are entirely in darkness, attack rolls have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against you.

items.name: Crescent Moon
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic and Radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Phenomenon
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can tap into a special power of your current {@subclassFeature Lunar Embodiment|Sorcerer|XPHB|Lunar|RTReestablished|3} phase. Alternatively, as part of the Bonus Action you take to change your Lunar Phase using the {@subclassFeature Waxing and Waning|Sorcerer|XPHB|Lunar|RTReestablished|6} feature, you can immediately use the power of the lunar phase you are entering:

items.name: Full Moon
items.entry: You radiate moonlight for a moment. Each creature of your choice within a 30 foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} from you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. In addition, one creature of your choice in the Emanation regains {@dice 3d8} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

items.name: New Moon
items.entry: You momentarily emanate gloom. Each creature of your choice within a 30 foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} from you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 3d10} Necrotic damage and have its Speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. In addition, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn, or until immediately after you make an attack roll or cast a spell.

items.name: Crescent Moon
items.entry: You can magically teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of yourself. You can bring along one willing creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself. That creature teleports to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of your destination space. In addition, you and that creature have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage until the start of your next turn.

entries: Once you use one of these benefits, you can’t use that benefit again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Sorcery
entries: {@i Command the Prowling Shadows}

Your magic is born from the Shadowfell, where darkness and shadow hold sway. This power might come from an ancestor entwined with that plane or from an encounter with its grim energy. The shadow magic within you leaves its mark, giving you an eerie presence and traits that reflect the Shadowfell’s chilling influence. You may find yourself cold to the touch, your heartbeat unnaturally slow, or even forgetting how to distinguish between the living and the dead. Your very essence is tinged with the shadowy magic that courses through you, making you a creature apart from the mortal world.

entries.caption: Shadow Sorcerer Quirks
rows: You are always icy cold to the touch.
When you are asleep, you don’t appear to breathe (though you must still breathe to survive).
You barely bleed, even when badly injured.
Your heart beats once per minute. This event sometimes surprises you.
You have trouble remembering that living creatures and corpses should be treated differently.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Spells
entries: When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Shadow Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Shadow Spells
rows: {@spell Blindness/Deafness|XPHB}, {@spell Darkness|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Dark
entries: The Shadowfell's power surrounds you, granting you the following benefits.

items.name: Darkvision
items.entry: You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Darkness
items.entry: You can cast the {@spell Darkness|XPHB} spell by spending 2 Sorcery Points instead of a spell slot. When you do so, you can see through the darkness created by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Strength of the Grave
entries: Your existence in a twilight state between life and death makes you difficult to defeat. When damage reduces you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can make a Charisma saving throw (DC equals 10 or half the damage you take, whichever number is higher). On a success, you instead drop to 1 Hit Point. You can’t use this feature if you are reduced to 0 Hit Points by Radiant damage or by a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.
After the saving throw succeeds, you can’t use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hound of Ill Omen
entries: You gain the ability to call forth a howling creature of darkness to harass your foes. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you spend 3 Sorcery Points to conjure a Hound of Ill Omen in an unnoccupied space within 60 feet of you. This incorporeal Hound counts as neither a creature nor an object, but appears as a shadowy animal of your choice. The Hound persists for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or use this feature again. On subsequent turns, you can move the Hound up to 60 feet as a Bonus Action.

When conjured or at the end of its movement, the Hound can target one creature within 5 feet of it and you know the target’s location until the end of your next turn. While it remains within 5 feet of the target you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Sorcerous Prey.
items.entry: When you cast a spell that targets only this creature, you can spend 2 less sorcery points on Metamagic options this turn (to a minimum of 0).

items.name: Umbral Tactics.
items.entry: Melee attacks against this creature from you or your allies have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

items.name: Shadow Scent.
items.entry: The target is considered visible to you, even if it has the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition or you have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition. You do not recieve this benefit if it is behind {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover}.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Walk
entries: You gain the ability to step from one shadow into another.

When you are in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB}t or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to magically teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in Dim Light or Darkness. You can expend 2 Sorcery Points to remove the restriction that you must start and end the teleport in Dim Light or Darkness.
In addition, your Hound of Ill Omen can move as if it had a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} and could hover.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Form
entries: As a Bonus Action you magically transform yourself into a shadowy form. You can also use this feature when activating {@classFeature Innate Sorcery|Sorcerer|XPHB|1}.

While active, you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage except Force and Radiant damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside a creature or an object, you take {@damage 1d10} Force damage and are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space. You also gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your Speed and can hover.
In addition, while in this form, your Hound of Ill Omen can be commanded at the start of your turn, rather than requiring a Bonus Action.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend 6 Sorcery Points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Sorcery
entries: {@i Control the Roar of the Storm}

Your magic is born from the elemental power of air. Perhaps it was awakened by a near-death encounter with a great storm, or you were born amidst a legendary gale. Maybe your bloodline carries the influence of air elementals or djinn. Whatever its origin, the storm’s energy courses through you, granting you the ability to manipulate wind and weather. As a storm sorcerer, you are a powerful force at sea, capable of controlling the elements to protect your allies and fend off threats from the deep.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Spells
entries: When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Storm Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Storm Spells
rows: {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}, {@spell Thunderclap|XPHB}, {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB}, {@spell Shatter|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Storm Rider
entries: Your connection to the magic of the storm allows you to glide in its roar. Immediately before or after you cast the {@spell Thunderclap|XPHB} cantrip or a spell of 1st level or higher, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn to cause whirling gusts of elemental air to briefly surround you. You fly up to 10 feet without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: Your closeness to the magic of the storm will bend its fury to your will.

items.name: Storm Resistance
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Lightning and Thunder damage.

items.name: Eye of the Storm
items.entry: When you cast a spell that deals Lightning or Thunder damage that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can choose one creature in the spell's area of effect. The chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, and it takes no damage if it would normally take half damage on a successful save.

items.name: Echoes of the Storm
items.entry: When you cast any level 1+ spell that deals Lightning or Thunder damage, stormy magic erupts from you. This eruption causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you to take Lightning or Thunder damage (choose each time this ability activates) equal to half your Sorcerer level.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Storm
entries: While your Innate Sorcery is active, you recieve the following benefits:

items.name: Storm's Fury
items.entry: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to deal Lightning damage to the attacker equal to your Sorcerer level. It must also make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be pushed up to 20 feet straight away from you.

items.name: Wind's Pavise
items.entry: Wind whips around you, making projectiles miss their mark. You have Half Cover against ranged attacks and Dexterity saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Wind Soul
entries: The storm inside of you becomes more powerful.

items.name: One with the Storm
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Lightning and Thunder damage and you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.

items.name: Blessing of the Tempest
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can reduce your {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} to 30 feet for 1 hour and choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. The chosen creatures gain Fly Speed of 30 feet for 1 hour. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Patron
entries: {@i Defy Mortality, Embrace Eternity}

Your pact is with an ageless entity that has transcended mortality to achieve eternal existence. These beings, having outlived countless generations, hold the secrets of life and death, offering their ancient wisdom to those who serve their inscrutable purposes. Possible patrons include Vecna, the Whispered One; Iuz the Evil; Vol, the lich-queen; the deathless Undying Court of Aerenal; Vlaakith, ruler of the githyanki; Fistandantalus, the eternal wizard; Larloch the Shadow King, master of Warlock’s Crypt; and Gilgeam, the God-King of Unther.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Eternal Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Eternal Spells
rows: {@spell Blindness/Deafness|XPHB}, {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB}, {@spell Silence|XPHB}, {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Grim Resolve
entries: Your unnatural resilience allows you to defy death and restore vitality when it is nearly lost.

items.name: Defy Death
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

items.name: Second Breath
items.entry: When you succeed on a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d8} + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 Hit Point). Alternatively, when you stabilize a creature with {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB}, the target can regain the Hit Points instead. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Nature
entries: Your patron's power fills your body with everlasting energy:

items.name: Age Pace
items.entry: You age at a slower rate. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year, and you are immune to being magically aged.

items.name: Everlasting Spells
items.entry: You gain the {@optfeature Eldritch Mind|XPHB} {@classFeature Eldritch Invocations|Warlock|XPHB|1|Eldritch Invocation} and it doesn’t count against the number of invocations you can have. You can’t replace this invocation.

items.name: Needless
items.entry: You can hold your breath indefinitely, and you don't require food, water, or sleep, although you still need rest to reduce {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} and can still benefit from finishing {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} and {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB|Long Rests}.

items.name: Unyielding Recovery
items.entry: You can now regain the use of Second Breath when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Death Repeller
entries: Your patron's energy now saturates your body:

items.name: Necrotic Immunity
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

items.name: Decrease Exhaustion
items.entry: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, decreases by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Indestructible Life
entries: You partake some of the true secrets of the Eternal:

items.name: Eternal Vigor
items.entry: At the start of each of your turns, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Charisma modifier if you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} and have at least 1 Hit Point.

items.name: Reattach
items.entry: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, if you or another creature places a severed body part of yours back in place, the part reattaches.

subclassFeature.name: Fathomless Patron
entries: {@i Become a Vessel of Thalassic Might}

Your pact connects you to the mysterious powers of the ocean depths. You might have entered a pact with a mighty kraken, an ancient water elemental, a demigod worshiped by merfolk, or a coven of sea hags. Or perhaps your patron is an enigmatic force from the Elemental Plane of Water, an otherworldly sea, or even a godlike hallucination conjured by the dreams of kuo-toa. The reasons for your pact may vary—a shipwreck that left you on the brink of death, a generational cult dedicated to these entities, or a desire to explore the unknown mysteries of the deep. Your path is shaped by the will of the waters and the secrets they conceal beneath their waves.

subclassFeature.name: Fathomless Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Fathomless Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Fathomless Spells
rows: {@spell Create or Destroy Water|XPHB}, {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}, {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB}, {@spell Silence|XPHB}
{@spell Bigby's Hand|XPHB} (appears as a tentacle), {@spell Cone of Cold|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Gift of the Sea
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet, and you can breathe underwater.

subclassFeature.name: Tentacle of the Deeps
entries: You can magically summon a spectral tentacle that strikes at your foes. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you create a 10-foot-long tentacle at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. The tentacle lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature to create another tentacle.

When you create the tentacle, you can make a melee spell attack against one creature within 10 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage, and its Speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. When you reach 10th level in this class, the damage increases to {@damage 2d8}.
As a Bonus Action on your turn, you can move the tentacle up to 30 feet and repeat the attack.
You can summon the tentacle a number of times equal to your Charisma Modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Coil
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Tentacle of the Deeps|Warlock|XPHB|Fathomless|RTReestablished|3} can defend you and others, interposing itself between them and harm. When you or a creature you can see takes damage while within 10 feet of the tentacle, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to choose one of those creatures and reduce the damage to that creature by an amount equal to your Warlock level.

subclassFeature.name: Oceanic Soul
entries: You are now even more at home in the depths. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage. In addition, when you are fully submerged, any creature that is also fully submerged can understand your speech, and you can understand theirs.

subclassFeature.name: Grasping Tentacles
entries: You always have the {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles|XPHB} spell prepared. You can also cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Whenever you cast this spell, your patron's magic bolsters you. You gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Warlock level and you can't lose {@condition  Concentration|XPHB} on this spell as a result of taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fathomless Plunge
entries: You can magically open temporary conduits to watery destinations. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can teleport yourself and up to five other willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet of you. Amid a whirl of tentacles, you all vanish and then reappear up to 1 mile away in a body of water you've seen (pond size or larger) or within 30 feet of it, each of you appearing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the others.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Genie Patron
entries: {@i Make a Wish, Make a Deal}

Your pact is with a rare and powerful noble genie, a ruler of vast domains within the Elemental Planes. These genies command lesser genies and elemental beings, wielding powers that approach those of minor gods. While their motivations vary, they are often haughty and eager to exploit any opportunity to turn the tables on mortals who seek to bind them. By entering into a pact with a noble genie, you gain access to their immense elemental might and their cunning influence over reality.
You choose your patron's kind or determine it randomly, using the Genie Kind table.

subclassFeature.name: Genie Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Genie Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared. You prepare the spells in the Genie Spells column and the column appropriate to your patron’s Genie Kind. In addition, the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell is added to the Warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Genie Spells
rows: {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB}, {@spell Phantasmal Force|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Genie’s Vessel
entries: Your patron gifts you a magical vessel that grants you a measure of the genie’s power. The vessel is a Tiny {@variantrule object|XPHB}, and you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Warlock spells. You decide what the object is, or you can determine what it is randomly by rolling on the Genie's Vessel table.

items.name: Bottled Respite
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the vessel and magically vanish and enter your vessel, which remains in the space you left. The interior of the vessel is an extradimensional space in the shape of a 20-foot-radius Cylinder, which is 20 feet high, and resembles your vessel. The interior is appointed with cushions and low tables and is a comfortable temperature. While inside, you can hear the area around your vessel as if you were in its space. You can remain inside the vessel up to a number of hours equal to twice your Charisma modifier (minimum, 1 hour).
