You exit the vessel early if you use a Bonus Action to leave, if you die, or if the vessel is destroyed. When you exit the vessel, you appear in the unoccupied space closest to it. Any objects left in the vessel remain there until carried out, and if the vessel is destroyed, every object stored there harmlessly appears in the unoccupied spaces closest to the vessel’s former space. Once you enter the vessel, you can’t enter again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Genie's Wrath
items.entry: Once during each of your turns, when you hit with an attack roll while touching the vessel, you can deal extra damage to the target equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1 damage). The type of this damage is determined by your patron’s Genie Kind.

items.name: Vessel Statistics
items.entry: The vessel’s AC equals your spell save DC. Its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal your Warlock level plus your Charisma modifier, and it has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage.

items.name: Restoring the Vessel
items.entry: If the vessel is destroyed or you lose it, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, and the previous vessel is destroyed if it still exists.

entries: The vessel vanishes in a flare of elemental power when you die.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Gift
entries: You begin to take on characteristics of your patron’s kind. You now have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to a damage type determined by your patron’s Genie Kind.

In addition, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can give yourself a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 30 feet that lasts for 10 minutes, during which you can {@variantrule Hover|XPHB}. You can use this Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Sanctuary Vessel
entries: When you enter your {@subclassFeature Genie’s Vessel|Warlock|XPHB|Genie|RTReestablished|3} via the Bottled Respite feature, you can now choose up to five willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet of you, and the chosen creatures are drawn into the vessel with you.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can eject any number of creatures from the vessel, and everyone is ejected if you leave or die or if the vessel is destroyed.

In addition, anyone (including you) who remains within the vessel for at least 10 minutes gains the benefit of finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and anyone can add your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) to the number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} they regain if they spend any {@variantrule Hit Die|XPHB|Hit Dice} as part of a Short Rest there.

subclassFeature.name: Limited Wish
entries: You entreat your patron to grant you a small wish. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can speak your desire to your {@subclassFeature Genie’s Vessel|Warlock|XPHB|Genie|RTReestablished|3}, requesting the effect of{@filter one spell that is 6th level or lower and has a casting time of an Action|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5;6|time=action}. The spell can be from any class's spell list, and you don't need to meet the requirements in that spell, including costly components; the spell simply takes effect as part of this Magic action.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hexblade Patron
entries: {@i Bind Your Soul to a Shadowed Weapon}

Your pact is with a dark entity from the Shadowfell, a realm of gloom. This force manifests through sentient weapons imbued with shadow, such as the infamous Blackrazor. Warlocks bound to this pact gain control over shadowy magic and weapons. Some say the Raven Queen, who may have crafted these weapons, uses hexblade warlocks to subtly influence the Material Plane for her mysterious purposes.

subclassFeature.name: Hexblade Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Hexblade Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Hexblade's Curse
entries: You gain the ability to place a baleful curse on someone. When you cast {@spell Hex|XPHB}, you can modify it so that it doesn’t require {@condition Concentration|XPHB}. If you do so, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute, and ends early if you cast Hex again, or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. For the duration, you also gain the following benefits against the target:

items.name: Improved Critical
items.entry: Any attack roll you make against the target is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

items.name: Soul Eater
items.entry: When the target dies, you can choose to end Hex early and regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 Hit Point).

entries: In addition You can cast Hex once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast it in this way again when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hex Warrior
entries: The influence of your patron also allows you to gain combat skills and mystically channel your will through a particular weapon.

items.name: Armor Training
items.entry: You gain training with medium armor and shields.

items.name: Pact of the Blade
items.entry: You gain the {@optfeature Pact of the Blade|XPHB} {@classFeature Eldritch Invocations|Warlock|XPHB|1||Eldritch Invocation} and it doesn't count for the number of invocations you can have. You can't replace this invocation.

subclassFeature.name: Accursed Specter
entries: You can curse the soul of a creature you slay, temporarily binding it in your service. When you use your Soul Eater feature, and the target of your Hex was a {@filter Humanoid|bestiary|type=humanoid} creature, you can cause its spirit to rise from its corpse as an {@creature Accursed Specter|RTReestablished}, as detailed below. In combat, it shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands. If you don’t issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

The Accursed Specter remains in your service until the end of your next {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at which point it vanishes to the afterlife. Once you bind an Accursed Specter with this feature, you can't use the feature again until you finish a Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: Your hex grows more powerful. When the target of your {@spell Hex|XPHB} deals damage to you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to reduce the damage you take by half (round down).

Once you use this Reaction, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you spend a {@classFeature Pact Magic|Warlock|XPHB|1} spell slot (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Hexes
entries: Your {@creature Accursed Specter|RTReestablished} can make two attacks when taking the {@action Attack|XPHB} action instead of one. In addition, the damage die of your {@spell Hex|XPHB} increases to d8.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Patron
entries: {@i Pledge to the Powers Beyond the Grave}

Your pact is with a deathless entity—a being that has transcended mortality to endlessly pursue its dark ambitions. These ancient undead have outlived the limitations of life and death, viewing time and morality as the fleeting concerns of mortals. Having once been alive, they possess unique insights into the path of ambition and the secrets that lie beyond death’s door. Such beings are eager to share their dark knowledge and forbidden secrets with those willing to serve their will among the living.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Spells
entries: The magic of your otherworldly patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Undead Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Undead Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|XPHB}, {@spell Blindness/Deafness|XPHB}, {@spell False Life|XPHB}, {@spell Phantasmal Force|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Form of Dread
entries: You manifest an aspect of your patron’s dreadful power. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you transform for 1 minute. You gain the following benefits while transformed:

items.name: Temporary Hit Points
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Warlock level.

items.name: Dreadful Strikes
items.entry: Once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw, and if the saving throw fails, the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Fear Immunity
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Appearance
items.entry: The appearance of your Form of Dread reflects some aspect of your patron. For example, your form could be a shroud of shadows forming the crown and robes of your lich patron, or your body might glow with glyphs from ancient funerary rites and be surrounded by desert winds, suggesting your mummy patron.

entries: You can transform a number of times equal to your Charisma Modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Grave Touched
entries: Your patron’s influence affects your body and magic. You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe.

In addition, once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack roll and roll damage against the creature, you can replace the damage type with Necrotic damage. While you are using your {@subclassFeature Form of Dread|Warlock|XPHB|Undead|RTReestablished|3}, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the Necrotic damage the target takes.

subclassFeature.name: Necrotic Husk
entries: Your connection to undeath and necrotic energy now saturates your body. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. If you are transformed using your {@subclassFeature Form of Dread|Warlock|XPHB|Undead|RTReestablished|3}, you instead have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

In addition, when you would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to instead have a number of Hit Points equal to your Warlock level plus your Charisma modifier and cause your body to erupt with deathly energy. Each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you takes Necrotic damage equal to {@damage 2d10} + your Warlock level. You then gain 1 level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. Once you use this Reaction, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Projection
entries: Your spirit can become untethered from your physical form. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can project your spirit from your body. The body you leave behind has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition and is in a state of suspended animation.

Your spirit resembles your mortal form in almost every way, replicating your game statistics but not your possessions. Any damage or other effects that apply to your spirit or physical body affects the other. Your spirit can remain outside your body for up to 1 hour or until your {@condition Concentration|XPHB} is broken (as if Concentrating on a spell). When your projection ends, your spirit returns to your body or your body magically teleports to your spirit's space (your choice). While projecting your spirit, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Resistances
items.entry: Your spirit and body gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

items.name: Spirit Casting
items.entry: When you cast a {@filter spell of the Conjuration or Necromancy school|spells|school=C;N}, the spell doesn’t require Verbal or Somatic components or Material components that lack a gold cost.

items.name: Fly Speed
items.entry: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your walking speed and can {@variantrule Hover|XPHB}. You can move through creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, but you take {@damage 1d10} Force damage if you end your turn inside a creature or an object.

items.name: Necrotic Healing
items.entry: While you are using your {@subclassFeature Form of Dread|Warlock|XPHB|Undead|RTReestablished|3}, once during each of your turns when you deal Necrotic damage to a creature, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half the amount of Necrotic damage dealt.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Chronurgist
entries: {@i Command the Passage of Moments as a Temporal Artisan}

Chronurgists focus on manipulating the flow of time itself, bending reality to their will with expert precision. Harnessing anticipatory dunamis energy, these mages adjust the pace of events like a virtuoso commanding an instrument, granting themselves and their allies an edge in the blink of an eye.

subclassFeature.name: Chronal Shift
entries: You can magically exert limited control over the flow of time around a creature. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, after you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can force the creature to reroll. You can use this ability twice, and you regain any expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Awareness
entries: Your talent for glimpsing various possible outcomes enhances your combat readiness. You gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Momentary Stasis
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can force a Large or smaller creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is encased in a field of magical energy until the end of your next turn or until the creature takes any damage. While encased in this way, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and has a Speed of 0.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Abeyance
entries: When you cast a spell with a casting time of an Action using a spell slot of level 4 or lower, you can condense the spell's magic into a mote. The spell is frozen in time at the moment of casting and held within a gray bead for 1 hour. This bead is a Tiny {@variantrule object|XPHB} with AC 15 and 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, and it has {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage. When the duration ends, or if the bead is destroyed, it vanishes in a flash of light, and the spell is lost.

A creature holding the bead can take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to release the spell within, whereupon the bead disappears. The spell uses your spell attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes.
Once you create a bead with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Convergent Future
entries: You can peer through possible futures and magically pull one of them into events around you, ensuring a particular outcome. When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to ignore the die roll and decide whether the number rolled is the minimum needed to succeed or one less than that number (your choice).
When you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Conjurer
entries: {@i Call Forth Beings from Far Realms}

As a Conjurer, you excel at spells that manifest objects and beings from nothingness. Whether summoning a creature to aid you in battle or calling forth dense fog to obscure and confound, your magic manipulates the fabric of reality. With growing mastery, you gain the ability to traverse vast distances and planes in the blink of an eye, bending space to your will.

subclassFeature.name: Conjuration Savant
entries: Choose {@filter two Wizard spells from the Conjuration school|spells|class=wizard|school=C|level=2}, each of which must be no higher than level 2. and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add {@filter one Wizard spell from the Conjuration school|spells|class=wizard|school=C} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Conjure Familiar
entries: Your knowledge in the art of conjuration allows you to materialize an animal-shaped assistant.

items.name: Find Familiar
items.entry: You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared.

items.name: Free Conjuration
items.entry: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell without Material components and without expending a spell slot, but you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Conjuration
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can conjure an inanimate {@variantrule object|XPHB} in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that you have seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet.
The object disappears after 1 hour, when you use this feature again, if it takes any damage, or if it deals any damage.

subclassFeature.name: Benign Transposition
entries: You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. Alternatively, you can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is willing, you both teleport, swapping places.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or you cast a Conjuration spell of level 1+ to regain its use.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Conjuration
entries: While you are {@condition Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a Conjuration spell, your Concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Durable Summons
entries: Any creature that you summon or create with a Conjuration spell has {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice your Wizard level.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanter
entries: {@i Subjugates Hearts and Minds with a Whisper}

As an Enchanter, you have perfected the art of influencing minds and emotions with a mere word or gesture. Some Enchanters use their talents to spread peace, convincing aggressors to abandon their weapons and compelling the merciless to show compassion. Others wield their power to dominate, bending others to their will with magical force. Most Enchanters walk a fine line between benevolence and control, using their enchantments to shape the world around them.

subclassFeature.name: Enchantment Savant
entries: Choose {@filter two Wizard spells from the Enchantment school|spells|class=wizard|school=E|level=2}, each of which must be no higher than level 2. and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add {@filter one Wizard spell from the Enchantment school|spells|class=wizard|school=E} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Spellbound Grace
entries: Your deep understanding and constant exposure to enchantment magic has infused your presence with a subtle, magical charm.

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Persuasion|XPHB}. In addition, your knowledge of enchantments gives you a bonus to your selected skill’s checks. The bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum bonus of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Hypnotic Gaze
entries: Your soft words and enchanting gaze can magically enthrall a creature. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, choose one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. If the target can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. While Charmed in this way, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, its Speed drops to 0, attack rolls against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, and it appears visibly dazed.

On subsequent turns, you can use a Magic action to maintain this effect, extending its duration until the end of your next turn. The effect ends if you move more than 5 feet away from the creature, if the creature can no longer see or hear you, or if the creature takes damage.

Once the effect ends, or if the creature succeeds on its initial saving throw, you can’t use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Instictive Charm
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature has the Charmed condition until the start of your next turn or until you or your allies deal damage to it, and the attack must target a different creature of your choice within range. Once you have used this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. On a successful save, this feature is not expended. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 3+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Split Enchantment
entries: When you cast an Enchantment spell using a level 1+ spell slot that can be cast with a higher-level spell slot to target an additional creature, you can increase its effective level by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Alter Memories
entries: You gain the ability to make a creature unaware of your magical influence on it. When you cast an Enchantment spell that inflicts the Charmed condition on one or more creatures, you can alter one creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being Charmed.

Additionally, once before the spell expires, you can use a Magic action to try to make the chosen creature forget some of the time it spent Charmed. The creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw against your wizard spell save DC or lose a number of hours of its memories equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). You can make the creature forget less time, and the amount of time can't exceed the duration of your Enchantment spell.

subclassFeature.name: Graviturgist
entries: {@i Orchestrate the Pull of Gravity like a Maestro of Destruction}

Graviturgist Wizards master the forces that bind and repel matter, manipulating gravity’s raw energy to their Advantage and their enemies’ detriment. With control over these violent forces, they reshape the battlefield with the sheer power of gravitational magic.

subclassFeature.name: Adjust Density
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can alter the weight of one object or creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The object or creature must be Large or smaller. The target's weight is halved or doubled for up to 1 minute or until your {@condition Concentration|XPHB} ends (as if you were Concentrating on a spell).

items.name: Halved Weight
items.entry: The creature's Speed increases by 10 feet, it can jump twice as far as normal, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and Strength Saving Throws.

items.name: Doubled Weight
items.entry: The creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength checks and Strength Saving Throws.

entries: Upon reaching level 10 in this class, you can target an object or a creature that is Huge or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Well
entries: Whenever you cast a spell on a creature, you can move the target 5 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice if the target is willing to move, the spell hits it with an attack, or it fails a saving throw against the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Violent Attraction
entries: WYou harness the forces of momentum and gravity, magnifying the destructive power of impacts and falls around you.

items.name: Momentum Surge
items.entry: When another creature that you can see within 60 feet of you hits with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to increase the attack's velocity, causing the attack's target to take an extra {@damage 1d10} damage of the same type.

items.name: Terminal Acceleration
items.entry: If a creature within 60 feet of you takes damage from a fall, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to increase the fall's damage by {@damage 2d10}.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Event Horizon
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can emit a powerful field of gravitational energy that tugs at other creatures for up to 1 minute or until your {@condition Concentration|XPHB} ends (as if you were Concentrating on a spell). For the duration, whenever a creature hostile to you starts its turn within 30 feet of you, it must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d10} Force damage, and its Speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage, and every foot it moves this turn costs 2 extra feet of movement.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 3+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Necromancer
entries: {@i Command the Powers of Life, Death, and Undeath}

As a Necromancer, you delve into the dark arts that govern the boundaries of life and death. Your studies grant you the ability to harness the vital energies that animate the living, allowing you to drain life from your foes to fuel your own power. As your mastery grows, you learn to wield death itself as a weapon, turning the lifeblood of others into a source of your own dark strength.

Necromancers are often feared or shunned, seen as harbingers of doom due to their intimate connection with death. Though not all who follow this path are malevolent, the magic they wield is often regarded with suspicion and dread by society.

subclassFeature.name: Necromancy Savant
entries: Choose {@filter two Wizard spells from the Necromancy school|spells|class=wizard|school=N|level=2}, each of which must be no higher than level 2. and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add {@filter one Wizard spell from the Necromancy school|spells|class=wizard|school=N} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Harvest
entries: You gain the ability to reap life energy from creatures you kill with your spells.

When you cast a spell using a level 1+ spell slot and it kills at least one enemy that isn’t a {@filter Construct|bestiary|type=construct} or {@filter Undead|bestiary|type=undead}, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to twice the spell’s level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the school of Necromancy.

subclassFeature.name: Whispers of the Fallen
entries: Your knowledge in the art of necromancy allows you to communicate with the dead.

items.name: Speak with Dead
items.entry: You always have the {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} spell prepared.

items.name: Forcing Last Words
items.entry: You can cast {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} using a 1st- or 2nd-level spell slot. When you do, the number of questions you can ask the corpse is equal to the level of the spell slot used.

subclassFeature.name: Funeral Summons
entries: You always have the {@spell Summon Undead|XPHB} spell prepared. You can replace its Material component with a corpse or a pile of bones, which become the Undead Spirit for the spell's duration. When casted in this way, the Undead Spirit have the following benefits:

items.name: Vigor
items.entry: It gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Wizard level.

items.name: Undead Fortitude
items.entry: Once per cast, if damage reduces the Undead Spirit to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it drops to 1 Hit Point instead. It can’t use this feature if it is reduced to 0 hit points by Radiant damage or by a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Inured to Undeath
entries: You have spent so much time dealing with undead and the forces that animate them that you have become inured to some of their worst effects.

items.name: Fearless
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Resistance
items.entry: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage.

items.name: Tomb Fortitude
items.entry: Your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum can’t be reduced by another creature.

subclassFeature.name: Command Undead
entries: You can modify the {@spell Dominate Monster|XPHB} spell so that it doesn’t require {@condition Concentration|XPHB} and the target does not repeat the saving throw when it takes damage. If you do so, the target must be an Undead creature, and the spell ends early if you modify it in this way again.

In addition, you can cast Dominate Monster modified in this way once without expending a spell slot or having the spell prepared, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Scribe
entries: {@i Master Magic with Ink and your Living Grimoire}

As a Scribe Wizard, you master the magic of the written word, constantly studying books and crafting new arcane theories. You are never far from your collection of tomes and scrolls, always seeking ancient knowledge and hidden secrets. Unlike other wizards, your spellbook is more than a tool; it is a sentient ally that shares your journey and discoveries, making it a unique and irreplaceable companion in your pursuit of knowledge.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Spellbook
entries: Using specially prepared inks and ancient incantations passed down by your wizardly order, you have awakened an arcane sentience within your spellbook.
While you are holding the book, it grants you the following benefits:

items.name: Damage Swap
items.entry: When you cast a wizard spell with a spell slot, you can temporarily replace its damage type with a type that appears in another spell of the same level expended in your spellbook.

items.name: Quick Ritual
items.entry: When you cast a Wizard spell as a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}, you can use the spell's normal casting time, rather than adding 10 minutes to it. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries: If necessary, you can replace the book over the course of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} by using your {@subclassFeature Wizardly Quill|Wizard|XPHB|Scribe|RTReestablished|3} to write arcane sigils in a blank book or a magic spellbook to which you're attuned. At the end of the rest, your spellbook's consciousness is summoned into the new book, which the consciousness transforms into your spellbook, along with all its spells. If the previous book still existed somewhere, all the spells vanish from its pages.

subclassFeature.name: Wizardly Quill
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can magically create a Tiny quill in your free hand. The magic quill has the following properties:

items.name: Inkless
items.entry: The quill doesn’t require ink. When you write with it, it produces non-magical ink in a color of your choice on the writing surface.

items.name: Scribing Savant
items.entry: The time you must spend to copy a spell into your spellbook equals 2 minutes per spell level if you use the quill for the transcription. The cost is also reduced by half.

items.name: Erasing Words
items.entry: You can erase anything you write with the quill if you wave the feather over the text as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, provided the text is within 5 feet of you.

entries: This quill disappears if you create another one or if you die.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Mind
entries: You can conjure forth the mind of your {@subclassFeature Awakened Spellbook|Wizard|XPHB|Scribe|RTReestablished|3}. As a  {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while the book is on your person, you can cause the mind to manifest as a Tiny spectral {@variantrule object|XPHB}, hovering in an unoccupied space you can see of your choice within 60 feet of you. The spectral mind is intangible and doesn't occupy its space, and it sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. It looks like a ghostly tome, a cascade of text, or a scholar from the past (your choice).

items.name: Senses
items.entry: While manifested, the spectral mind can hear and see, and it has {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. The mind can telepathically share with you what it sees and hears (no action required).

items.name: Shared Spellcasting
items.entry: Whenever you cast a Wizard spell on your turn, you can cast it as if you were in the spectral mind's space, instead of your own, using its senses. You can do so a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Moving the Mind
items.entry: As a Bonus Action, you can cause the spectral mind to hover up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you or it can see. It can pass through creatures but not objects.

items.name: Early End
items.entry: The spectral mind stops manifesting if it is ever more than 300 feet away from you, if someone casts {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} on it, if the Awakened Spellbook is destroyed, if you die, or if you dismiss the spectral mind as a Bonus Action.

entries: Once you conjure the mind, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you expend a spell slot to regain its use (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Master Scrivener
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can create one magic scroll by touching your {@subclassFeature Wizardly Quill|Wizard|XPHB|Scribe|RTReestablished|3} to a blank piece of paper or parchment and causing one spell from your {@subclassFeature Awakened Spellbook|Wizard|XPHB|Scribe|RTReestablished|3} to be copied onto the scroll. The spellbook must be within 5 feet of you when you make the scroll.

The chosen spell must be of level 1 or 2 and must have a casting time of an Action. Once in the scroll, the spell’s power is enhanced, counting as one level higher than normal. You can cast the spell from the scroll by reading it as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action. The scroll is unintelligible to anyone else, and the spell vanishes from the scroll when you cast it or when you finish your next Long Rest.

You are also adept at crafting {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG|Spell Scrolls}, which are described in {@book Chapter 6|XPHB|6} of the {@book Player’s Handbook|XPHB}. The gold and time you must spend to make such a scroll are halved if you use your Wizardly Quill.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Word
entries: Your connection to your {@subclassFeature Awakened Spellbook|Wizard|XPHB|Scribe|RTReestablished|3} has become so profound that your soul has become entwined with it. While the book is on your person, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) checks, as the spellbook helps you remember magical lore.

Moreover, if you take damage while your spellbook's mind is manifested, you can prevent all of that damage to you by taking a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to dismiss the spectral mind, using its magic to save yourself. Then roll {@dice 2d6}. You temporarily unprepare spells of your choice that have a combined spell level equal to that roll or higher. For example, if the roll's total is 9, you unprepare spells that have a combined level of at least 9, which could mean one 9th-level spell, three 3rd-level spells, or some other combination. If there aren't enough spells prepared to cover this cost, you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
Once you use this Reaction, you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Transmuter
entries: {@i Forge Reality Anew with a Thought}

As a Transmuter, you study spells that alter energy and matter, seeing the world as a canvas ready for transformation. You thrive on change, using your magic to reshape physical forms and mental states alike, wielding the raw forces of creation. Your abilities allow you to manipulate the elements, turning lead into gold or transforming creatures for amusement or gain. While some Transmuters are playful tricksters, others approach their craft with a solemn resolve, aspiring to wield powers that can reshape or destroy entire worlds.

subclassFeature.name: Transmutation Savant
entries: Choose {@filter two Wizard spells from the Transmutation school|spells|class=wizard|school=T|level=2}, each of which must be no higher than level 2. and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add {@filter one Wizard spell from the Transmutation school|spells|class=wizard|school=T} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Reformation
entries: By mastering the principles of transmutation, you can change the nature of objects and substances to match your needs. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can transmutate reality in one of the following ways:

items.name: Adaptive Arsenal
items.entry: Convert a listed non-magical {@table Weapons|XPHB|Weapon}, {@table Armor|XPHB} or {@table Adventuring Gear|XPHB} you touch, into another one of equal or lesser value.

items.name: Currency Conversion
items.entry: Convert coin pieces of your choice within 5 feet of you into its equivalent on copper, silver, gold or platinum pieces. The maximum number of resulting pieces cannot exceed 100 times your Intelligence modifier.

items.name: Wealth into Wonder
items.entry: Convert gold pieces of your choice within 5 feet of you into the Material components that have a specific cost indicated in a spell's description from your spellbook. The number of gold pieces must be equal to the cost of the Material component.

items.name: Quick Transmutation
items.entry: You cast a Wizard cantrip you know from the Transmutation school with a casting time of an Action.

items.name: Purify Essence
items.entry: You can remove the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition from a creature you touch.

entries: You can't use this feature to convert things that are worn or carried.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Transmuter's Stone
entries: You can spend 8 hours (which can be over the course of a Long Rest) creating a Transmuter's Stone that stores transmutation magic. You can benefit from the stone yourself or give it to another creature. A creature gains Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws and one additional benefit of your choice as long as the stone is in the creature's possession. When you create the stone, choose the benefit from the following options:

items.name: Darkvision
items.entry: The creature gains {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If it already has Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Speed
items.entry: The creature's Speed increases by 10 feet. It also has a {@variantrule Climb Speed|XPHB} and a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to its Speed.

items.name: Resistance
items.entry: The creature gains {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder or Poison damage (your choice whenever you choose this benefit).

items.name: Master of Forms
items.entry: The creature can cast {@spell Alter Self|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. Intelligence is its spellcasting ability for the spell when is casted in this way.

entries: Each time you cast a Transmutation spell of level 1+, you can change the effect of your stone if the stone is on your person.
If you create a new Transmuter's Stone, the previous one ceases to function.

subclassFeature.name: Shapechanger
entries: You can transform your form while keeping your intellect, adapting seamlessly to any situation.

items.name: Polymorph
items.entry: You always have the {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} spell prepared.

items.name: Wise Shape
items.entry: You can cast {@spell Polymorph|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can target only yourself, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma scores, and you can only transform into a {@filter beast whose challenge rating is 1 or lower|bestiary|type=beast|cr=1}. Once you cast Polymorph in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Master Transmuter
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can consume the reserve of transmutation magic stored within your {@subclassFeature Transmuter's Stone|Wizard|XPHB|Transmuter|RTReestablished|6} in a single burst. When you do so, choose one of the following effects. Your Transmuter's Stone is destroyed and can't be remade until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Major Transformation
items.entry: You touch the Transmuter's Stone to one nonmagical object—no larger than a 5-foot cube— that isn't worn or carried. The object transmutes into another nonmagical object of similar size and mass and of equal or lesser value.

items.name: Panacea
items.entry: You remove all {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}, curses, diseases and poisons affecting a creature that you touch with the Transmuter’s Stone. The creature also regains all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and restores back to normal any reduction on its Hit Point maximum or Ability Scores.

items.name: Restore Life
items.entry: You cast the {@spell Raise Dead|XPHB} spell on a creature you touch with the Transmuter's Stone, without expending a spell slot or needing to have the spell prepared.

items.name: Restore Youth
items.entry: You touch the Transmuter's Stone to a willing creature, and that creature's apparent age is reduced by {@dice 3d10} years, to a minimum of 13 years. This effect doesn't extend the creature's lifespan.

subclassFeature.name: War Mage
entries: {@i Combine Spellfire with Unyielding Defense}

War Mages are wizards trained in the art of battle, combining the destructive power of evocation with the protective strength of abjuration. They wield their magic as both weapon and armor, seizing control of the battlefield with spells that strike with precision and defenses that shield against attacks. Their expertise allows them to turn opponents’ magic against them, making them versatile and formidable combatants.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Deflection
entries: You have learned to weave your magic to fortify yourself against harm.

items.name: Arcane Buckler
items.entry: When you are hit by an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain a +2 bonus to your AC, potentially causing the attack to miss you. You gain this bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Arcane Lifesaver
items.entry: When you fail a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain a +4 bonus to that saving throw.

entries: When you use this feature, you can't cast spells other than cantrips until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Wit
entries: Your keen ability to assess tactical situations allows you to act quickly in battle. When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Power Surge
entries: You can store magical energy within yourself to later empower your damaging spells. In its stored form, this energy is called a power surge.

items.name: Spell Denier
items.entry: You always have the {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} and {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} spells prepared.

items.name: Number of Power Surges
items.entry: You can store a maximum number of Power Surges equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one). Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, your number of Power Surges resets to one. If you end a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} with no power surges, you gain one Power Surge.

items.name: Gaining Power Surges
items.entry: Whenever you successfully end or interrupt a spell with {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} or {@spell Counterspell|XPHB}, you gain one Power Surge, as you steal magic from the spell you foiled.

items.name: War Magic Surge
items.entry: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature or object with a Wizard spell, you can spend one Power Surge to deal extra Force damage to to one target of the spell. The extra damage equals your Wizard level.

subclassFeature.name: Durable Magic
entries: The magic you channel helps ward off harm. While you maintain {@condition Concentration|XPHB} on a spell, you have a +2 bonus to AC and all saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Deflecting Shroud
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Arcane Deflection|Wizard|XPHB|War Mage|RTReestablished|3} becomes infused with deadly magic that arcs from you. When you use your Arcane Deflection feature, choose up to three creatures that you can see within 60 feet of you, each takes Force damage equal to half your Wizard level.

table.name: Wild Magic
table.caption: Wild Magic
rows: Shadowy tendrils lash around you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} Necrotic damage. You also gain 1d12 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

You teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

An intangible spirit, which looks like a {@creature Flumph|XMM} or a {@creature Pixie|XMM} (your choice), appears within 5 feet of one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At the end of the current turn, the spirit explodes, and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Force damage. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you can use this effect again, summoning another spirit, on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

Magic infuses one weapon of your choice that you are holding. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, the weapon's damage type changes to force, and it gains the Light and Thrown properties, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If the weapon leaves your hand, the weapon reappears in your hand at the end of the current turn.
Whenever a creature hits you with an attack roll before your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} Force damage, as magic lashes out in retribution.

Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you are surrounded by multi colored, protective lights; you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and while within 10 feet of you, your allies gain the same bonus.
Flowers and vines temporarily grow around you. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, the ground within 15 feet of you is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for your enemies.

A bolt of light shoots from your chest. Another creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage and have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. Until your {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|XPHB|1} ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

table.name: Spirit Tales
table.caption: Spirit Tales
rows: {@i {@b Tale of the Clever Animal.}} For the next 10 minutes, whenever the target makes an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma check, the target can roll an extra die and add the extra die's number to the check. The extra die is the same type as your Bardic Inspiration die.

{@i {@b Tale of the Renowned Duelist.}} You make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to two rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier.

{@i {@b Tale of the Beloved Friends.}} The target and another creature of its choice it can see within 5 feet of it gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier.

{@i {@b Tale of the Runaway.}} The target can immediately take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. When the target teleports, it can choose a number of creatures it can see within 30 feet of it up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0) to immediately use the same Reaction.
{@i {@b Tale of the Avenger.}} For 1 minute, any creature that hits the target with a melee attack takes Force damage equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die.

{@i {@b Tale of the Traveler.}} The target gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Bard level. While it has these Temporary Hit Points, the target's Speed increases by 10 feet and it gains a +1 bonus to its AC.

{@i {@b Tale of the Beguiler.}} The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take Psychic damage equal to two rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die, and the target is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} until the end of its next turn.

{@i {@b Tale of the Phantom.}} The target gains the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn or until it hits a creature with an attack. If the target hits a creature with an attack before the condition ends, the creature it hits takes Necrotic damage equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition with the target as the source until the end of the creature’s next turn.

{@i {@b Tale of the Brute.}} Each creature of the target's choice it can see within 30 feet of it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Thunder damage equal to three rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage only.

{@i {@b Tale of the Dragon.}} The target spews fire from the mouth in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking fire damage equal to four rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@i {@b Tale of the Angel.}} The target regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to two rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier, and you can end one of the following conditions on it: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}.

{@i {@b Tale of the Mind-Bender.}} You evoke an incomprehensible fable from an otherworldly being. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take Psychic damage equal to three rolls of your Bardic Inspiration die and have the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The item is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Irrepressible Dance
entries: When any creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the item, the item can increase or decrease (your choice) the {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of that creature by 10 feet until the end of the turn, provided the item doesn't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Force-Empowered Slam
entries: {@atkr mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d10} plus your Charisma modifier Force damage

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Druid level

action.name: Flame Seed
entries: {@atkr r} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 60 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d6} + your Wisdom modifier Fire damage

action.name: Fiery Teleportation
entries: The Spirit and each willing creature of your choice within 5 feet of it teleport up to 15 feet to unoccupied spaces you can see. Then each creature within 5 feet of the space that the spirit left must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 1d6} + your Wisdom modifier Fire damage.

hp.special: 5 plus five times your Ranger level (the drake has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your Ranger level)

immune.special: determined by the Drake’s Draconic Essence trait

trait.name: Draconic Essence
entries: When you summon the drake, choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. The chosen type determines the drake's damage Immunity and the damage of its Infused Strikes trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6} plus your Wisdom modifier Piercing damage

reaction.name: Infused Strikes
entries: When another creature within 30 feet of the Drake that it can see hits a target with a weapon attack, the Drake infuses the strike with its essence, causing the target to take an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the type determined by its Draconic Essence.

monster.name: Accursed Specter

hp.special: 20 plus half of your Warlock level

languages: understands all languages it knew in life, but can't speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Accursed Specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Accursed Touch
entries: {@atkr ms} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10} plus your Charisma modifier Necrotic damage, and the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the end of the Accursed Specter's next turn.
